members.member: @brief Event for Initialized signal which can be used to subscribe/unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user. Initialized signal is emitted when application is initialised
@brief Event for Terminated signal which can be used to subscribe/unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user. Terminated signal is emitted when application is terminating
@brief Event for Paused signal which can be used to subscribe/unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user. Paused signal is emitted when application is paused
@brief Event for Resumed signal which can be used to subscribe/unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user. Resumed signal is emitted when application is resumed
@brief Event for Reset signal which can be used to subscribe/unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user. Reset signal is emitted when application is reset
@brief Event for LanguageChanged signal which can be used to subscribe/unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user. LanguageChanged signal is emitted when the region of the device is changed.
@brief Event for RegionChanged signal which can be used to subscribe/unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user. RegionChanged signal is emitted when the region of the device is changed.
@brief Event for BatteryLow signal which can be used to subscribe/unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user. BatteryLow signal is emitted when the battery level of the device is low.
@brief Event for MemoryLow signal which can be used to subscribe/unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user. MemoryLow signal is emitted when the memory level of the device is low.

@brief Event for AppControl signal which can be used to subscribe/unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user. AppControl signal is emitted when another application sends a launch request to the application.

member.exception: Thrown when failed because of an invalid parameter.
Thrown when the memory is insufficient.
Thrown when failed to create the frame broker handle.
member.remarks: This class is only avaliable for platform level signed applications.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.FrameBrokerBase.SendLaunchRequest(Tizen.Applications.AppControl,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sends the launch request asynchronously.
member.remarks:
The operation is mandatory information for the launch request. If the operation is not specified, AppControlOperations.Default is used by default. If the operation is AppControlOperations.Default, the application ID is mandatory to explicitly launch the application.
Since Tizen 2.4, the launch request of the service application over out of packages is restricted by the platform. Also, implicit launch requests are NOT delivered to service applications since 2.4. To launch a service application, an explicit launch request with the application ID given by property ApplicationId MUST be sent.
member.param: The flag, if it's true, the launch request is sent to the frame provider application.
member.returns: A task with the result of the launch request.
member.exception: Thrown when failed because of the argument is invalid.
Thrown when the application to run is not found.
Thrown when the launch request is rejected.

member.summary: Notifies that the object is prepared to show.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.FrameProvider.NotifyHideStatus(Tizen.Applications.Bundle)

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.GaussianBlurView
member.summary: GaussianBlurView is a class for applying a render process that blurs an image.

members.member: This will be public opened in tizen_6.0 after ACR done. Before ACR, need to be hidden as inhouse API.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.GaussianBlurView.Dispose(Tizen.NUI.DisposeTypes)
member.summary: Dispose GaussianBlurView and all children on it.

member.name: E:Tizen.NUI.GaussianBlurView.Finished
member.summary: If ActivateOnce has been called, then connect to this signal to be notified when the target actor has been rendered.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.GaussianBlurView.BlurStrength
member.summary: The BlurStrength property. A value of 0.0 is zero blur and 1.0 is full blur. Default is 1.0. if you set the blur to 0.0, the result will be no blur BUT the internal rendering will still be happening. If you wish to turn the blur off, you should remove the GaussianBlurView object from the window also.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.GaussianBlurView.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.GaussianBlurView.#ctor(System.UInt32,System.Single,Tizen.NUI.PixelFormat,System.Single,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructor with parameters.
member.param: The size of the Gaussian blur kernel (number of samples in horizontal / vertical blur directions)

The constant controlling the Gaussian function, must be > 0.0. Controls the width of the bell curve, i.e. the look of the blur and also indirectly the amount of blurriness Smaller numbers for a tighter curve. Useful values in the range [0.5..3.0] - near the bottom of that range the curve is weighted heavily towards the centre pixel of the kernel (so there won't be much blur), near the top of that range the pixels have nearly equal weighting (closely approximating a box filter therefore). Values close to zero result in the bell curve lying almost entirely within a single pixel, in other words there will be basically no blur as neighbouring pixels have close to zero weights.
The pixel format of the render targets we are using to perform the blur.

width scale factor applied during the blur process, scaling the size of the source image to the size of the final blurred image output. Useful for downsampling - trades visual quality for processing speed. A value of 1.0f results in no scaling applied.

The height scale factor applied during the blur process, scaling the size of the source image to the size of the final blurred image output. Useful for downsampling - trades visual quality for processing speed. A value of 1.0f results in no scaling applied.
If this is set to true, the GaussianBlurView object will operate in a special mode that allows the user to blur an image of their choice. See SetUserImageAndOutputRenderTarget().

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.GaussianBlurView.#ctor(Tizen.NUI.GaussianBlurView)
member.summary: Copy constructor

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.GaussianBlurView.Activate
member.summary: Start rendering the GaussianBlurView. Must be called after you Add() it to the window.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.GaussianBlurView.ActivateOnce
member.summary: Render the GaussianBlurView once. Must be called after you Add() it to the window. Listen to the Finished signal to determine when the rendering has completed.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.GaussianBlurView.Deactivate
member.summary: Stop rendering the GaussianBlurView. Must be called after you Remove() it from the window.

member.summary: Locations are longest path from zero-vertex. that means 'locations[MAX] - locations[0]' is maximun size of children. Since GridLayout is Directed Acyclic Graph(DAG) which have no negative cycles, longest path can be found in linear time.

members.member: Note that the IEnumerator documentation requires an InvalidOperationException to be thrown whenever the collection is modified. This has been done for changes in the size of the collection, but not when one of the elements of the collection is modified as it is a bit tricky to detect unmanaged code that modifies the collection under our feet. 3

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.Uint16Pair
member.summary:
Simple class for passing around pairs of small unsigned integers.
Use this for integer dimensions and points with limited range such as image sizes and pixel coordinates where a pair of floating point numbers is inefficient and illogical (i.e.the data is inherently integer).
One of these can be passed in a single 32 bit integer register on common architectures.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.Binding.BindingMode
member.summary: The direction of changes propagation for bindings.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.Binding.BindingMode.Default
member.summary: When used in Bindings, indicates that the Binding should use the DefaultBindingMode. When used in BindableProperty declaration, defaults to BindingMode.OneWay.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.Binding.BindingMode.TwoWay
member.summary: Indicates that the binding should propagates changes from source (usually the View Model) to target (the BindableObject) in both directions.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.Binding.BindingMode.OneWay
member.summary: Indicates that the binding should only propagate changes from source (usually the View Model) to target (the BindableObject). This is the default mode for most BindableProperty values.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.Binding.BindingMode.OneWayToSource
member.summary: Indicates that the binding should only propagate changes from target (the BindableObject) to source (usually the View Model). This is mainly used for read-only BindableProperty values.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.Binding.BindingMode.OneTime
member.summary: Indicates that the binding will be applied only when the binding context changes and the value will not be monitored for changes with INotifyPropertyChanged.

members.member:
AccessibilityManager manages registration of views in an accessibility focus chain and changing the focused view within that chain. This class provides the functionality of registering the focus order and description of views and maintaining the focus chain. It provides functionality of setting the focus and moving the focus forward and backward. It also draws a highlight for the focused view and emits a signal when the focus is changed.
6 This will be public opened in tizen_6.0 after ACR done. Before ACR, need to be hidden as inhouse API.
This will not be public opened.

Enumeration for accessibility that needs four information which will be read by screen-reader.
Reading order : Label -> Trait -> Optional (Value and Hint)
6 This will be public opened in tizen_6.0 after ACR done. Before ACR, need to be hidden as inhouse API.

Simple text which contained in components, such as Ok or Cancel in case of a button
6 This will be public opened in tizen_6.0 after ACR done. Before ACR, need to be hidden as inhouse API.

Sets the information of the specified view's accessibility attribute.
The view to be set with The attribute type the text to be set with The text for the view's accessibility information 6 This will be public opened in tizen_6.0 after ACR done. Before ACR, need to be hidden as inhouse API.

Gets the text of the specified view's accessibility attribute.
The view to be queried The attribute type to be queried The text of the view's accessibility information 6 This will be public opened in tizen_6.0 after ACR done. Before ACR, need to be hidden as inhouse API.

Sets the focus order of the view. The focus order of each view in the focus chain is unique. If there is another view assigned with the same focus order already, the new view will be inserted to the focus chain with that focus order, and the focus order of the original view and all the views followed in the focus chain will be increased accordingly. If the focus order assigned to the view is 0, it means that view's focus order is undefined (e.g. the view has a description but with no focus order being set yet) and therefore that view is not focusable.
the view to be set with the focus order to be set with 6 This will be public opened in tizen_6.0 after ACR done. Before ACR, need to be hidden as inhouse API.

Gets the focus order of the view. When the focus order is 0, it means the focus order of the view is undefined.
the view to be set with The focus order of the view 6 This will be public opened in tizen_6.0 after ACR done. Before ACR, need to be hidden as inhouse API.

Generates a new focus order number which can be used to assign to views which need to be appended to the end of the current focus order chain. The new number will be an increment over the very last focus order number in the focus chain. If the focus chain is empty then the function returns 1, else the number returned will be FOLast + 1 where FOLast is the focus order of the very last control in the focus chain.
The focus order of the view 6 This will be public opened in tizen_6.0 after ACR done. Before ACR, need to be hidden as inhouse API.

Gets the view that has the specified focus order. It will return an empty handle if no view in the window has the specified focus order.
The focus order of the view The view that has the specified focus order or an empty handle if no view in the stage has the specified focus order 6 This will be public opened in tizen_6.0 after ACR done. Before ACR, need to be hidden as inhouse API.

Moves the focus to the specified view. Only one view can be focused at the same time. The view must have a defined focus order and must be focusable, visible and in the window.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.Adaptor
member.summary:
An Adaptor object is used to initialize and control how Dali runs.
It provides the lifecycle interface that allows the application writer to provide their own main loop and other platform related features.
The Adaptor class provides a means for initialising the resources required by the Dali::Core.
When dealing with platform events, the application writer must ensure that DALi is called in a thread-safe manner.
As soon as the Adaptor class is created and started, the application writer can initialise their view objects straight away or as required by the main loop they intend to use (there is no need to wait for an initialize signal as per the Tizen.NUI.Application class).

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Adaptor.Instance
member.summary: Returns a reference to the instance of the adaptor used by the current thread.
member.remarks: The adaptor has been initialized. This is only valid in the main thread.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Adaptor.FeedWheelEvent(Tizen.NUI.Wheel)
member.summary: Feeds a wheel event to the adaptor.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Adaptor.FeedKeyEvent(Tizen.NUI.Key)
member.summary: Feeds a key event to the adaptor.
member.param: The key event holding the key information.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Adaptor.SetRenderRefreshRate(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Sets the number of frames per render.
member.param: The number of vsyncs between successive renders.
member.remarks: Suggest this is a power of two: 1 - render each vsync frame. 2 - render every other vsync frame. 4 - render every fourth vsync frame. 8 - render every eighth vsync frame.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Adaptor.ReleaseSwigCPtr(System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef)
member.summary: ReleaseSwigCPtr

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.AlphaFunction
member.summary:
Alpha functions are used in animations to specify the rate of change of the animation parameter over time.
Understanding an animation as a parametric function over time, the alpha function is applied to the parameter of the animation before computing the final animation value.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.AlphaFunction.#ctor(System.Delegate)
member.summary:
The constructor.
Creates an alpha function object with the user-defined alpha function.
member.param: User defined fuction. It must be a method formatted as float alphafunction(float progress)

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.AlphaFunction.#ctor
member.summary:
The default constructor.
Creates an alpha function object with the default built-in alpha function.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.AlphaFunction.#ctor(Tizen.NUI.AlphaFunction.BuiltinFunctions)
member.summary:
The constructor.
Creates an alpha function object with the built-in alpha function passed as a parameter to the constructor.
member.param: One of the built-in alpha functions.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.AlphaFunction.#ctor(Tizen.NUI.Vector2,Tizen.NUI.Vector2)
member.summary:
The constructor.
Creates a bezier alpha function. The bezier will have the first point at (0,0) and the end point at (1,1).
member.remarks: The x components of the control points will be clamped to the range [0, 1] to prevent non-monotonic curves.
member.param: A Vector2 which will be used as the first control point of the curve.
A Vector2 which will be used as the second control point of the curve.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.Animation
member.summary:
Animation can be used to animate the properties of any number of objects, typically view.
If the "Finished" event is connected to a member function of an object, it must be disconnected before the object is destroyed.
This is typically done in the object destructor, and requires either the animation handle to be stored.
The overall animation time is superseded by the values given in the animation time used when calling the AnimateTo(), AnimateBy(), AnimateBetween() and AnimatePath() methods.
If any of the individual calls to those functions exceeds the overall animation time (Duration), then the overall animation time is automatically extended.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Animation.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Creates an initialized animation.
The animation will not loop.
The default end action is "Cancel".
The default alpha function is linear.
member.remarks: DurationmSeconds must be greater than zero.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.Animation.EndActions
member.summary: Enumeration for what to do when the animation ends, stopped, or destroyed.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.Animation.EndActions.Cancel
member.summary: When the animation ends, the animated property values are saved.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.Animation.EndActions.Discard
member.summary: When the animation ends, the animated property values are forgotten.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.Animation.EndActions.StopFinal
member.summary: If the animation is stopped, the animated property values are saved as if the animation had run to completion, otherwise behaves like cancel.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.Animation.Interpolation
member.summary: Enumeration for what interpolation method to use on key-frame animations.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.Animation.Interpolation.Linear
member.summary: Values in between key frames are interpolated using a linear polynomial. (Default)

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.Animation.Interpolation.Cubic
member.summary: Values in between key frames are interpolated using a cubic polynomial.

member.summary: Enumeration for what state the animation is in.
member.remarks: Calling Reset() on this class will not reset the animation. It will call the BaseHandle.Reset() which drops the object handle.

member.summary: The animation has stopped.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.Animation.States.Playing
member.summary: The animation is playing.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.Animation.States.Paused
member.summary: The animation is paused.

member.summary: Gets or sets the duration in milliseconds of the animation.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Animation.DefaultAlphaFunction
member.summary: Gets or sets the default alpha function for the animation.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Animation.State
member.summary: Queries the state of the animation.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Animation.LoopCount
member.summary:
Set: Enables looping for a specified number of repeats. A zero is the same as Looping = true; i.e., repeat forever.
This property resets the looping value and should not be used with the Looping property.
Setting this parameter does not cause the animation to Play().
Get: Gets the loop count. A zero is the same as Looping = true; i.e., repeat forever.
The loop count is initially 1 for play once.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Animation.Looping
member.summary:
Gets or sets the status of whether the animation will loop.
This property resets the loop count and should not be used with the LoopCount property.
Setting this parameter does not cause the animation to Play().

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Animation.EndAction
member.summary:
Gets or sets the end action of the animation.
This action is performed when the animation ends or if it is stopped.
The default end action is cancel.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Animation.CurrentLoop
member.summary:
Gets the current loop count.
A value 0 indicating the current loop count when looping.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Animation.DisconnectAction
member.summary:
Gets or sets the disconnect action.
If any of the animated property owners are disconnected from the stage while the animation is being played, then this action is performed.
The default action is cancel.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Animation.CurrentProgress
member.summary:
Gets or sets the progress of the animation.
The animation will play (or continue playing) from this point.
The progress must be in the 0-1 interval or in the play range interval if defined
otherwise, it will be ignored.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Animation.SpeedFactor
member.summary:
Gets or sets specificifications of a speed factor for the animation.
The speed factor is a multiplier of the normal velocity of the animation.
Values between [0, 1] will slow down the animation and values above one will speed up the animation.
It is also possible to specify a negative multiplier to play the animation in reverse.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Animation.PlayRange
member.summary:
Gets or sets the playing range.
Animation will play between the values specified. Both values (range.x and range.y ) should be between 0-1, otherwise they will be ignored. If the range provided is not in proper order (minimum, maximum ), it will be reordered.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Animation.ProgressNotification
member.summary:
Gets or sets the progress notification marker which triggers the ProgressReachedSignal.
Percentage of animation progress should be greater than 0 and less than 1, for example, 0.3 for 30%
One notification can be set on each animation.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Animation.Properties
member.summary: Gets or sets the properties of the animation.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Animation.DestValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the destination value for each property of the animation.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Animation.StartTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the start time for each property of the animation.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Animation.EndTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the end time for each property of the animation.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Animation.DownCast(Tizen.NUI.BaseHandle)
member.summary:
Downcasts a handle to animation handle.
If handle points to an animation object, the downcast produces a valid handle.
If not, the returned handle is left uninitialized.
member.returns: Handle to an animation object or an uninitialized handle.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Animation.Stop(Tizen.NUI.Animation.EndActions)

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Animation.AnimatePath(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View,Tizen.NUI.Path,Tizen.NUI.Vector3,Tizen.NUI.AlphaFunction)
member.summary:
Animates the view's position and orientation through a predefined path.
The view will rotate to orient the supplied forward vector with the path's tangent.
If forward is the zero vector then no rotation will happen.
member.param: The vector (in local space coordinate system) will be oriented with the path's tangent direction.

member.summary:
Plays the animation from a given point.
The progress must be in the 0-1 interval or in the play range interval if defined, otherwise, it will be ignored.
member.param: A value between [0,1], or between the play range if specified, from where the animation should start playing.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Animation.PlayAfter(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Plays the animation after a given delay time.
The delay time is not included in the looping time.
When the delay time is a negative value, it would treat as play immediately.

member.summary: Defines the cache size for loading images in the Image-Array animation. number of images to keep cached ahead during playback. Default value: 1.
member.remarks: cacheSize should be >= batchSize. If it isn't, then the cache will automatically be changed to batchSize. because of the defaults, it is expected that the application developer tune the batch and cache sizes to their particular use case.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.CustomView.FocusNavigationSupport
member.summary:
Sets whether this control supports two dimensional keyboard navigation (i.e., whether it knows how to handle the keyboard focus movement between its child views).
The control doesn't support it by default.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.CustomView.FocusGroup
member.summary: Sets or gets whether this control is a focus group for keyboard navigation.
member.returns: True if this control is set as a focus group for keyboard navigation.

member.summary: Sets the background with a property map.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.CustomView.EnableGestureDetection(Tizen.NUI.Gesture.GestureType)
member.summary:
Allows deriving classes to enable any of the gesture detectors that are available.
Gesture detection can be enabled one at a time or in a bitwise format.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.CustomView.OnInitialize
member.summary:
This method is called after the control has been initialized.
Derived classes should do any second phase initialization by overriding this method.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.CustomView.OnStageConnection(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Called after the view has been connected to the stage.
When a view is connected, it will be directly or indirectly parented to the root view.
The root view is provided automatically by Tizen.NUI.Stage, and is always considered to be connected.
When the parent of a set of views is connected to the stage, then all of the children will receive this callback.
member.param: The depth in the hierarchy for the view.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.CustomView.OnStageDisconnection
member.summary:
Called after the view has been disconnected from the stage.
If a view is disconnected, it either has no parent, or is parented to a disconnected view.
When the parent of a set of views is disconnected to the stage, then all of the children will receive this callback, starting with the leaf views.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.CustomView.OnSceneConnection(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Called after the view has been connected to the scene.
When a view is connected, it will be directly or indirectly parented to the root view.
The root view is provided automatically by Tizen.NUI.Window, and is always considered to be connected.
When the parent of a set of views is connected to the scene, then all of the children will receive this callback.
member.param: The depth in the hierarchy for the view.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.CustomView.OnSceneDisconnection
member.summary:
Called after the view has been disconnected from the scene.
If a view is disconnected, it either has no parent, or is parented to a disconnected view.
When the parent of a set of views is disconnected to the scene, then all of the children will receive this callback, starting with the leaf views.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.CustomView.OnChildAdd(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View)
member.summary: Called after a child has been added to the owning view.
member.param: The child which has been added.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.CustomView.OnChildRemove(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View)
member.summary: Called after the owning view has attempted to remove a child( regardless of whether it succeeded or not ).

member.summary: Called when the owning view property is set.
member.param: The property index that was set.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.CustomView.OnSizeSet(Tizen.NUI.Vector3)
member.summary: Called when the owning view's size is set, for example, using View.SetSize().

member.summary:
Called after the size negotiation has been finished for this control.
The control is expected to assign this given size to itself or its children.
Should be overridden by derived classes if they need to layout views differently after certain operations like add or remove views, resize, or after changing specific properties.
As this function is called from inside the size negotiation algorithm, you cannot call RequestRelayout (the call would just be ignored).
member.param: The control should add views to this container that it is not able to allocate a size for.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.CustomView.RelayoutRequest
member.summary:
Requests a relayout, which means performing a size negotiation on this view, its parent, and children (and potentially whole scene).
This method can also be called from a derived class every time it needs a different size.
At the end of event processing, the relayout process starts and all controls which requested relayout will have their sizes (re)negotiated.
It can be called multiple times; the size negotiation is still only performed once, i.e., there is no need to keep track of this in the calling side.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.FlexContainer
member.summary:
FlexContainer implements a subset of the flexbox spec (defined by W3C):https://www.w3.org/TR/css3-flexbox/
It aims at providing a more efficient way to layout, align, and distribute space among items in the container, even when their size is unknown or dynamic.
FlexContainer has the ability to alter the width and the height of its children (i.e., flex items) to fill the available space in the best possible way on different screen sizes.
FlexContainer can expand items to fill available free space, or shrink them to prevent overflow.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.ImageView.WrapModeU
member.summary:
Gets or sets the wrap mode for the u coordinate.
It decides how the texture should be sampled when the u coordinate exceeds the range of 0.0 to 1.0.
If not specified, the default is WrapModeType.Default(CLAMP).
For normal quad images only.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.ImageView.WrapModeV
member.summary:
Gets or sets the wrap mode for the v coordinate.
It decides how the texture should be sampled when the v coordinate exceeds the range of 0.0 to 1.0.
The first two elements indicate the top-left position of the area, and the last two elements are the areas of the width and the height respectively.
If not specified, the default is WrapModeType.Default(CLAMP).
For normal quad images only. Optional.

member.summary: LottieAnimationView constructor
member.param: The factor of scaling image, default : 1.0f

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.LottieAnimationView.CurrentFrame
member.summary: Set or get the current frame. When setting a specific frame, it is displayed as a still image.
member.remarks: Gets the value set by a user. If the setting value is out-ranged, it is reset as a minimum frame or a maximum frame.

member.summary: Sets or gets the looping mode of Lottie animation.

member.summary: Sets or gets the loop count.
member.remarks: The minus value means the infinite loop count.

member.summary: Whether to redraw the image when the visual is scaled down.
member.remarks: Inhouse API. It is used in the AnimatedVectorImageVisual.The default is true.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.TableView
member.summary:
TableView is a layout container for aligning child actors in a grid like layout.
TableView constraints the X and the Y position and the width and the height of the child actors.
The Z position and depth are left intact so that the 3D model actors can also be laid out in a grid without loosing their depth scaling.

member.summary: Creates the TableView view.

member.summary: The Copy constructor. Creates another handle that points to the same real object.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.TableView.LayoutPolicy
member.summary: Enumeration for describing how the size of a row or column has been set.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.TableView.LayoutPolicy.Fixed
member.summary: Fixed with the given value.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.TableView.LayoutPolicy.Relative
member.summary: Calculated as percentage of the remainder after subtracting Padding and Fixed height/width.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.TableView.LayoutPolicy.Fill
member.summary: Default policy, get the remainder of the 100% (after subtracting Fixed, Fit and Relative height/ width) divided evenly between 'fill' rows/columns.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.TableView.LayoutPolicy.Fit
member.summary: Fit around its children.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.TableView.Rows
member.summary: The amount of rows in the table.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.TableView.Columns
member.summary: The amount of columns in the table.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.TableView.CellPadding
member.summary: Padding between cells.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.TableView.LayoutRows
member.summary: The number of layout rows.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.TableView.LayoutColumns
member.summary: The number of layout columns.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.TableView.AddChild(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View,Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.TableView.CellPosition)
member.summary:
Adds a child to the table.
If the row or column index is outside the table, the table gets resized bigger.
member.returns: True if the addition succeeded, and false if the cell is already occupied.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.TableView.GetChildAt(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.TableView.CellPosition)
member.summary: Returns a child from the given layout position.
member.returns: Child that was in the cell or an uninitialized handle.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.TableView.RemoveChildAt(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.TableView.CellPosition)
member.summary: Removes a child from the given layout position.
member.param: The position for the child to remove.
member.returns: Child that was removed or an uninitialized handle.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.TableView.FindChildPosition(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View,Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.TableView.CellPosition)
member.summary: Finds the child's layout position.
member.returns: True if the child was included in this TableView.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.TableView.InsertRow(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Inserts a new row to the given index.
member.param: The rowIndex of the new row.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.TableView.DeleteRow(System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Deletes a row from the given index.
Removed elements are deleted.
member.param: The rowIndex of the row to delete.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.TableView.InsertColumn(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Inserts a new column to the given index.
member.param: The columnIndex of the new column.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.TableView.DeleteColumn(System.UInt32)
member.summary:

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.TextLabel.MatchSystemLanguageDirection

members.member:
The text fit parameters.
The textFit map contains the following keys :
- enable (bool type) : True to enable the text fit or false to disable(the default value is false)
- minSize (float type) : Minimum Size for text fit(the default value is 10.f)
- maxSize (float type) : Maximum Size for text fit(the default value is 100.f)
- stepSize (float type) : Step Size for font increase(the default value is 1.f)
- fontSize (string type) : The size type of font, You can choose between "pointSize" or "pixelSize". (the default value is "pointSize")
This will be public opened in tizen_5.5 after ACR done. Before ACR, need to be hidden as inhouse API.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.TextUtils.Render(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.RendererParameters,Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.EmbeddedItemInfo[]@)
member.summary:
Renders text into a pixel buffer. @note: Can process a mark-up string. @note: It does the font selection, RTL reordering, shaping and layouting. @note: The width of the pixel buffer may be different to the given @e textWidth due to some padding pixels added.
The text is laid-out for the given size @e (textWidth,textHeight). If the @e multiLineEnabled option is enabled, the text will wrap in lines. If the @e ellipsisEnabled option is enabled, the text will be ellided if there is no more space for new lines.
It won't be rendered the parts of the text exceeding the boundaries of the given width and height.
If the given @e textHeight is zero, a big enough pixel buffer will be created to render the full text.
If the given @e textWidth is zero, the 'natural size' of the text will be used to create the pixel buffer to render the full text.
If the radius is not zero, the text will be laid-out following a circular path. In that case the text is laid-out in a single line.
If the mark-up string contains embedded items, the @p embeddedItemLayout vector contains the layout info of each embedded item.
member.param: The layout info of the embedded items
member.returns: A pixel buffer with the text rendered on it.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.TextUtils.CreateShadow(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.ShadowParameters)
member.summary:
Creates a shadow for the text given in the input pixel buffer. The function returns a RGBA8888 pixel buffer with the text and its shadow rendered on it.
The pixel format of the @e input pixel buffer could be an A8 or an RGBA8888. If it's an A8 pixel buffer, it uses the given @e textColor to give color to the text. Otherwise it uses the color of the @e input pixel buffer.
member.param: The parameters needed to create the text's shadow.
member.returns: A pixel buffer with the text and the shadow rendered on it.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.TextUtils.ConvertToRgba8888(Tizen.NUI.PixelBuffer,Tizen.NUI.Vector4,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts a @p pixelBuffer with pixel format A8 to RGBA8888 using the given @p color. @note Does nothing if the @p pixelBuffer is not A8.
member.param: The pixel buffer with pixel format A8
The color used to convert to RGBA8888
multiplyByAlpha Whether to multiply the @p color with the alpha value of the @p pixel @p buffer.
member.returns: The pixel buffer converted to RGBA8888.

The top left corner's y within the destination pixel buffer.
Whether to blend the source pixel buffer with the destination pixel buffer as background.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.Size2D
member.summary:
Sets the size of a view for the width and the height.
Geometry can be scaled to fit within this area.
This does not interfere with the view's scale factor.
The views default depth is the minimum of width and height.
member.remarks:
This NUI object (Size2D) typed property can be configured by multiple cascade setting.
For example, this code ( view.Size2D.Width = 100; view.Size2D.Height = 100; ) is equivalent to this ( view.Size2D = new Size2D(100, 100); ).

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.CurrentSize

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.Position2D
member.summary:
Sets the position of the view for X and Y.
By default, sets the position vector between the parent origin and the pivot point (default).
If the position inheritance is disabled, sets the world position.
member.remarks:
This NUI object (Position2D) typed property can be configured by multiple cascade setting.
For example, this code ( view.Position2D.X = 100; view.Position2D.Y = 100; ) is equivalent to this ( view.Position2D = new Position2D(100, 100); ).

member.remarks: If false, then the top-left of the view is used for the position. Setting this to false will allow scaling or rotation around the pivot point without affecting the view's position.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.ParentOrigin
member.summary:
Gets or sets the origin of a view within its parent's area.
This is expressed in unit coordinates, such that (0.0, 0.0, 0.5) is the top-left corner of the parent, and (1.0, 1.0, 0.5) is the bottom-right corner.
The default parent-origin is ParentOrigin.TopLeft (0.0, 0.0, 0.5).
A view's position is the distance between this origin and the view's anchor-point.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.PivotPoint
member.summary:
Gets or sets the anchor-point of a view.
This is expressed in unit coordinates, such that (0.0, 0.0, 0.5) is the top-left corner of the view, and (1.0, 1.0, 0.5) is the bottom-right corner.
The default pivot point is PivotPoint.Center (0.5, 0.5, 0.5).
A view position is the distance between its parent-origin and this anchor-point.
A view's orientation is the rotation from its default orientation, the rotation is centered around its anchor-point.
The view has been initialized.
member.remarks: The property cascade chaining set is possible. For example, this (view.PivotPoint.X = 0.1f;) is possible.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.SizeHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the size height of the view.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.Position
member.summary:
Gets or sets the position of the view.
By default, sets the position vector between the parent origin and pivot point (default).
If the position inheritance is disabled, sets the world position.
member.remarks:
Animatable - This property can be animated using Animation class.
The property cascade chaining set is possible. For example, this (view.Position.X = 1.0f;) is possible.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.DrawMode
member.summary:
Gets or sets the status of how the view and its children should be drawn.
Not all views are renderable, but DrawMode can be inherited from any view.
If an object is in a 3D layer, it will be depth-tested against other objects in the world, i.e., it may be obscured if other objects are in front.
If DrawMode.Overlay2D is used, the view and its children will be drawn as a 2D overlay.
Overlay views are drawn in a separate pass, after all non-overlay views within the layer.
For overlay views, the drawing order is with respect to tree levels of views, and depth-testing will not be used.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.SizeModeFactor
member.summary:
Gets or sets the relative to parent size factor of the view.
This factor is only used when ResizePolicyType is set to either: ResizePolicyType.SizeRelativeToParent or ResizePolicyType.SizeFixedOffsetFromParent.
This view's size is set to the view's size multiplied by or added to this factor, depending on ResizePolicyType.
member.remarks: The property cascade chaining set is possible. For example, this (view.DecorationBoundingBox.X = 0.1f;) is possible.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.WidthResizePolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets the width resize policy to be used.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.HeightResizePolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets the height resize policy to be used.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.SizeScalePolicy
member.summary:
Gets or sets the policy to use when setting size with size negotiation.
Defaults to SizeScalePolicyType.UseSizeSet.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.WidthForHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the status of whether the width size is dependent on the height size.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.HeightForWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the status of whether the height size is dependent on the width size.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.Padding
member.summary: Gets or sets the padding for use in layout.
member.remarks: The property cascade chaining set is possible. For example, this (view.Padding.X = 0.1f;) is possible.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.MinimumSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum size the view can be assigned in size negotiation.
member.remarks: The property cascade chaining set is possible. For example, this (view.MinimumSize.Width = 1;) is possible.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.MaximumSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size the view can be assigned in size negotiation.
member.remarks: The property cascade chaining set is possible. For example, this (view.MaximumSize.Width = 1;) is possible.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.InheritPosition
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether a child view inherits it's parent's position.
Default is to inherit.
Switching this off means that using position sets the view's world position, i.e., translates from the world origin (0,0,0) to the pivot point of the view.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.ClippingMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the clipping behavior (mode) of it's children.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.RendererCount
member.summary: Gets the number of renderers held by the view.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.AnchorPoint
member.summary: Deprecated in API5; Will be removed in API8. Please use PivotPoint instead!
member.remarks: The property cascade chaining set is possible. For example, this (view.AnchorPoint.X = 0.1f;) is possible.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.Size
member.summary:
Sets the size of a view for the width, the height and the depth.
Geometry can be scaled to fit within this area.
This does not interfere with the view's scale factor.
The views default depth is the minimum of width and height.
member.remarks:
Animatable - This property can be animated using Animation class.
The property cascade chaining set is possible. For example, this (view.Size.Width = 1.0f;) is possible.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.Parent
member.summary: Deprecated in API5; Will be removed in API8. Please use 'Container GetParent() for derived class' instead!

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.InheritLayoutDirection
member.summary: Gets/Sets whether inherit parent's the layout Direction.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.LayoutDirection

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.Margin
member.summary: Gets or sets the Margin for use in layout.
member.remarks: Margin property is supported by Layout algorithms and containers. Please Set Layout if you want to use Margin property. The property cascade chaining set is possible. For example, this (view.Margin.X = 0.1f;) is possible.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.EnableControlStatePropagation
member.summary: Enable/Disable ControlState propagation for children. It is false by default. If the View needs to share ControlState with descendants, please set it true. Please note that, changing the value will also changes children's EnableControlStatePropagation value recursively.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.EnableControlState
member.summary: If this property is set to true, the View can have a touch related ControlState (such as Pressed) when touch. By default, it is false in View, true in Control. Note that if the value is true, the View will be a touch receptor.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.GrabTouchAfterLeave
member.summary: Whether the actor grab all touches even if touch leaves its boundary.
member.returns: true, if it grab all touch after start

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.ThemeChangeSensitive
member.summary: If the value is true, the View will change its style as the theme changes. It is false by default, but turned to true when setting StyleName (by setting property or using specified constructor).

member.name: E:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.FocusGained
member.summary:
An event for the KeyInputFocusGained signal which can be used to subscribe or unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user.
The KeyInputFocusGained signal is emitted when the control gets the key input focus.

member.name: E:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.FocusLost
member.summary:
An event for the KeyInputFocusLost signal which can be used to subscribe or unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user.
The KeyInputFocusLost signal is emitted when the control loses the key input focus.

member.name: E:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.KeyEvent
member.summary:
An event for the KeyPressed signal which can be used to subscribe or unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user.
The KeyPressed signal is emitted when the key event is received.

member.name: E:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.Relayout
member.summary:
An event for the OnRelayout signal which can be used to subscribe or unsubscribe the event handler.
The OnRelayout signal is emitted after the size has been set on the view during relayout.

member.name: E:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.InterceptTouchEvent
member.summary:
An event for the touched signal which can be used to subscribe or unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user.
The touched signal is emitted when the touch input is received.
This can receive touch events before child.
If it returns false, the child can receive the touch event. If it returns true, the touch event is intercepted. So child cannot receive touch event.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.DisallowInterceptTouchEvent
E:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.TouchEvent
member.summary:
An event for the touched signal which can be used to subscribe or unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user.
The touched signal is emitted when the touch input is received.

member.name: E:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.HoverEvent
member.summary:
An event for the hovered signal which can be used to subscribe or unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user.
The hovered signal is emitted when the hover input is received.

member.name: E:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.WheelEvent
member.summary:
An event for the WheelMoved signal which can be used to subscribe or unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user.
The WheelMoved signal is emitted when the wheel event is received.

member.name: E:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.AddedToWindow
member.summary:
An event for the OnWindow signal which can be used to subscribe or unsubscribe the event handler.
The OnWindow signal is emitted after the view has been connected to the window.

member.name: E:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.RemovedFromWindow
member.summary:
An event for the OffWindow signal, which can be used to subscribe or unsubscribe the event handler.
OffWindow signal is emitted after the view has been disconnected from the window.

member.name: E:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.VisibilityChanged
member.summary:
An event for visibility change which can be used to subscribe or unsubscribe the event handler.
This signal is emitted when the visible property of this or a parent view is changed.

member.name: E:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.LayoutDirectionChanged
member.summary:
Event for layout direction change which can be used to subscribe/unsubscribe the event handler.
This signal is emitted when the layout direction property of this or a parent view is changed.

member.name: E:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.ResourcesLoaded

An event for the ResourcesLoadedSignal signal which can be used to subscribe or unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user.
This signal is emitted after all resources required by a view are loaded and ready.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.RaiseAbove(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View)
member.summary: Raises the view to above the target view.
member.remarks: The sibling order of views within the parent will be updated automatically. Views on the level above the target view will still be shown above this view. Raising this view above views with the same sibling order as each other will raise this view above them. Once a raise or lower API is used that view will then have an exclusive sibling order independent of insertion.
member.param: Will be raised above this view.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.LowerBelow(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View)
member.summary: Lowers the view to below the target view.
member.remarks: The sibling order of views within the parent will be updated automatically. Lowering this view below views with the same sibling order as each other will lower this view above them. Once a raise or lower API is used that view will then have an exclusive sibling order independent of insertion.
member.param: Will be lowered below this view.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.ClearBackground
member.summary: Clears the background.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.Show
member.summary: Shows the view.
member.remarks: This is an asynchronous method.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.Hide
member.summary: Hides the view.
member.remarks: This is an asynchronous method. If the view is hidden, then the view and its children will not be rendered. This is regardless of the individual visibility of the children, i.e., the view will only be rendered if all of its parents are shown.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.RaiseToTop
member.summary: Raises the view above all other views.
member.remarks: Sibling order of views within the parent will be updated automatically. Once a raise or lower API is used, that view will then have an exclusive sibling order independent of insertion.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.LowerToBottom
member.summary: Lowers the view to the bottom of all views.
member.remarks: The sibling order of views within the parent will be updated automatically. Once a raise or lower API is used that view will then have an exclusive sibling order independent of insertion.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.IsResourceReady
member.summary: Queries if all resources required by a view are loaded and ready.
member.remarks: Most resources are only loaded when the control is placed on the stage.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.GetLayer
member.summary: Gets the parent layer of this view.If a view has no parent, this method does not do anything.
member.returns: The parent layer of view

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.Unparent
member.summary: Removes a view from its parent view or layer. If a view has no parent, this method does nothing.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.FindChildByName(System.String)
member.summary: Search through this view's hierarchy for a view with the given name. The view itself is also considered in the search.
member.param: The name of the view to find.
member.returns: A handle to the view if found, or an empty handle if not.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.ScreenToLocal(System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Converts screen coordinates into the view's coordinate system using the default camera.
member.remarks: The view coordinates are relative to the top-left(0.0, 0.0, 0.5).
member.param: On return, the X-coordinate relative to the view.
On return, the Y-coordinate relative to the view.
member.returns: True if the conversion succeeded.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.SetSizeModeFactor(Tizen.NUI.Vector3)
member.summary:
Sets the relative to parent size factor of the view.
This factor is only used when ResizePolicy is set to either: ResizePolicy::SIZE_RELATIVE_TO_PARENT or ResizePolicy::SIZE_FIXED_OFFSET_FROM_PARENT.
This view's size is set to the view's size multiplied by or added to this factor, depending on ResizePolicy.
member.param: A Vector3 representing the relative factor to be applied to each axis.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.GetHeightForWidth(System.Single)
member.summary:
Calculates the height of the view given a width.
The natural size is used for default calculation.
Size 0 is treated as aspect ratio 1:1.
member.returns: The height based on the width.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.GetWidthForHeight(System.Single)
member.summary:
Calculates the width of the view given a height.
The natural size is used for default calculation.
Size 0 is treated as aspect ratio 1:1.
member.returns: The width based on the height.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.VisualView.OnRelayout(Tizen.NUI.Vector2,Tizen.NUI.RelayoutContainer)
member.summary:
Overrides the method of OnRelayout() for CustomView class.
Called after the size negotiation has been finished for this control.
The control is expected to assign this given size to itself or its children.
Should be overridden by derived classes if they need to layout actors differently after certain operations like add or remove actors, resize, or after changing specific properties.
member.remarks: As this function is called from inside the size negotiation algorithm, you cannot call RequestRelayout (the call would just be ignored).
member.param: The control should add actors to this container that it is not able to allocate a size for.

member.summary: Gets the number of children for this container. Read only

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Container.Add(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View)
member.summary: Adds a child view to this Container.
member.pre: This Container (the parent) has been initialized. The child view has been initialized. The child view is not the same as the parent view.
member.post: The child will be referenced by its parent. This means that the child will be kept alive, even if the handle passed into this method is reset or destroyed.
member.remarks: If the child already has a parent, it will be removed from the old parent and reparented to this view. This may change child's position, color, scale, etc. as it now inherits them from this view.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Container.Remove(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View)
member.summary: Removes a child view from this view. If the view was not a child of this view, this is a no-op.
member.pre: This View(the parent) has been initialized. The child view is not the same as the parent view.

member.summary: Retrieves the child view by the index.
member.param: The index of the child to retrieve.
member.returns: The view for the given index or empty handle if children are not initialized.

member.pre: The child container has been initialized.
member.returns: The parent container.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.CustomViewRegistry._constructorMap
member.summary: Maps the name of a custom view to a create instance function For example, given a string "Spin", we can get a function used to create the Spin View.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.CustomViewRegistry.Register(System.Func{Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.CustomView},System.Type)
member.summary:
The function which registers a view and all it's scriptable properties with DALi's type registry. Means the view can be created or configured from a JSON script.
The function uses introspection to scan a views C# properties, then selects the ones with [ScriptableProperty] attribute to be registered. Example of a Spin view registering itself: static Spin() { ViewRegistry registers control type with DALi type registery also uses introspection to find any properties that need to be registered with type registry ViewRegistry.Instance.Register(CreateInstance, typeof(Spin) ); }

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager
member.summary:
Provides the functionality of handling keyboard navigation and maintaining the two-dimensional keyboard focus chain.
It provides functionality of setting the focus and moving the focus in four directions( i.e., left, right, up, and down).
It also draws a highlight for the focused view and sends an event when the focus is changed.

member.name: E:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.PreFocusChange
member.summary:
PreFocusChange will be triggered before the focus is going to be changed.
The FocusManager makes the best guess for which view to focus towards the given direction, but applications might want to change that.
By connecting with this event, they can check the proposed view to focus and return a different view if they wish.
This event is only triggered when the navigation key is pressed and KeyboardFocusManager tries to move the focus automatically.
It won't be emitted for focus movement by calling the SetCurrentFocusView directly.

member.name: E:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.FocusChanged
member.summary: The FocusGroupChanged will be triggered after the current focused view has been changed.

member.name: E:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.FocusGroupChanged
member.summary:
The FocusGroupChanged will be triggered when the focus group has been changed.
If the current focus group has a parent layout control, the FocusManager will make the best guess for the next focus group to move the focus to in the given direction (forward or backward).
If not, the application has to set the new focus.

member.name: E:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.FocusedViewActivated
member.summary: The FocusedViewActivated will be triggered when the current focused view has the enter key pressed on it.

members.member:
[Obsolete("Please do not use! this will be deprecated")]
3 Please do not use! this will be deprecated! Instead please use FocusedViewActivated.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.ICustomFocusAlgorithm
member.summary:
ICustomFocusAlgorithm is used to provide the custom keyboard focus algorithm for retrieving the next focusable view.
The application can implement the interface and override the keyboard focus behavior.
If the focus is changing within a layout container, then the layout container is queried first to provide the next focusable view.
If this does not provide a valid view, then the Keyboard FocusManager will check focusable properties to determine the next focusable actor.
If focusable properties are not set, then the keyboard FocusManager calls the GetNextFocusableView() method of this interface.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.ICustomFocusAlgorithm.GetNextFocusableView(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View,Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View,Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.FocusDirection)
member.summary: Get the next focus actor.
member.returns: The next focus actor.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.FocusGroupLoop
member.summary:
Gets or sets the status of whether the focus movement should be looped within the same focus group.
The focus movement is not looped by default.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.FocusIndicator
member.summary:
Gets or sets the focus indicator view.
This will replace the default focus indicator view in the FocusManager and will be added to the focused view as a highlight.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.Instance
member.summary: Gets the singleton of the FocusManager object.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.SetCurrentFocusView(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View)
member.summary:
Moves the keyboard focus to the given view.
Only one view can be focused at the same time.
The view must be in the stage already and keyboard focusable.
member.returns: Whether the focus is successful or not.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.GetCurrentFocusView
member.summary: Gets the current focused view.
member.returns: A handle to the current focused view or an empty handle if no view is focused.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.MoveFocus(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View.FocusDirection)
member.summary: Moves the focus to the next focusable view in the focus chain in the given direction (according to the focus traversal order).
member.param: The direction of the focus movement.
member.returns: True if the movement was successful.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.ClearFocus
member.summary:
Clears the focus from the current focused view if any, so that no view is focused in the focus chain.
It will emit the FocusChanged event without the current focused view.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.MoveFocusBackward
member.summary: Move the focus to previous focused view.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.SetAsFocusGroup(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Sets whether the view is a focus group that can limit the scope of the focus movement to its child views in the focus chain.
Layout controls set themselves as focus groups by default.
member.param: The view to be set as a focus group.
Whether to set the view as a focus group or not.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.IsFocusGroup(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View)
member.summary: Checks whether the view is set as a focus group or not.
member.returns: Whether the view is set as a focus group.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.GetFocusGroup(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View)
member.summary: Returns the closest ancestor of the given view that is a focus group.
member.param: The view to be checked for its focus group.
member.returns: The focus group the given view belongs to or an empty handle if the given view.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.SetCustomAlgorithm(Tizen.NUI.FocusManager.ICustomFocusAlgorithm)
member.summary: Provides the implementation of a custom focus algorithm interface to allow the application to define the focus logic.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.Gesture
member.summary:
Base structure for different gestures that an application can receive.
A Gesture is an event that is produced from a combination of several touch events in a particular order or within a certain time frame (for example, pinch).

member.summary: The Copy constructor.
member.param: A reference to the copied handle

member.summary: Enumeration for type of gesture.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.Gesture.GestureType.Pinch
member.summary: When two touch points move away or towards each other.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.Gesture.GestureType.Pan
member.summary: When the user drags their finger(s) in a particular direction.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.Gesture.GestureType.Tap
member.summary: When the user taps the screen.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.Gesture.GestureType.LongPress
member.summary: When the user continues to touch the same area on the screen for the device configured time.

member.summary: Enumeration for state of the gesture.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.Gesture.StateType.Clear
member.summary: There is no state associated with this gesture.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.Gesture.StateType.Started
member.summary: The touched points on the screen have moved enough to be considered a gesture.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.Gesture.StateType.Continuing
member.summary: The gesture is continuing.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.Gesture.StateType.Finished
member.summary: The user has lifted a finger or touched an additional point on the screen.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.Gesture.StateType.Cancelled
member.summary: The gesture has been cancelled.

member.summary: A gesture is possible.

member.summary: The gesture state.

member.summary: The time the gesture took place.

members.member: This will not be public opened.

GestureDetectors analyse a stream of touch events and attempt to determine the intention of the user.
An view is attached to a gesture detector and if the detector recognises a pattern in its analysis, it will trigger a detected event to the application.
This is the base class for different gesture detectors available and provides functionality that is common to all the gesture detectors.
This will be public opened in tizen_5.0 after ACR done. Before ACR, need to be hidden as inhouse API.

Constructor. Creates an uninitialized GestureDetector.
This will be public opened in tizen_5.0 after ACR done. Before ACR, need to be hidden as inhouse API.

Constructor.
A reference to the copied handle This will be public opened in tizen_5.0 after ACR done. Before ACR, need to be hidden as inhouse API.

Attaches an view to the gesture. The detected event will be triggered when the gesture occurs on the attached view.
The view to attach to the gesture detector This will be public opened in tizen_5.0 after ACR done. Before ACR, need to be hidden as inhouse API.

Detaches the attached view from the gesture detector.
The view to detach from the gesture detector This will be public opened in tizen_5.0 after ACR done. Before ACR, need to be hidden as inhouse API.

Detaches all the views that have been attached to the gesture detector.
This will be public opened in tizen_5.0 after ACR done. Before ACR, need to be hidden as inhouse API.

Returns the number of views attached to the gesture detector.
The count This will be public opened in tizen_5.0 after ACR done. Before ACR, need to be hidden as inhouse API.

Returns an view by index. An empty handle if the index is not valid.
The attached view's index The attached view or an empty handle This will be public opened in tizen_5.0 after ACR done. Before ACR, need to be hidden as inhouse API.
This will not be public opened.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.GLWindow
member.summary:
The GLWindow class is to draw with native GLES.
This class is the special window. It is for native GLES application.
So, some special funtions and type are supported.
In addition, basic window's functions are supported, too.

member.summary:
Creates an initialized handle to a new GLWindow.
This creates an GLWindow with default options.!--
member.returns: A new GLWindow.

Creates an initialized handle to a new GLWindow.
This API can create GLWindow with specifc option.
member.param: The position and size of the Window.
member.returns: A new Window.

member.summary: Enumeration for orientation of the window is the way in which a rectangular page is oriented for normal viewing.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.GLWindow.SetOpaqueState(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Sets a transparent window's visual state to opaque.
If a visual state of a transparent window is opaque,
then the window manager could handle it as an opaque window when calculating visibility.
member.param: Whether the window's visual state is opaque.
member.remarks:
This will have no effect on an opaque window.
It doesn't change transparent window to opaque window but lets the window manager know the visual state of the window.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.GLWindow.IsOpaqueState
member.summary: Returns whether a transparent window's visual state is opaque or not.
member.returns: True if the window's visual state is opaque, false otherwise.
member.remarks: The return value has no meaning on an opaque window.

Emits the event when the screen is touched and when the touch ends.
If there are multiple touch points then it is emitted when the first touch occurs and when the last finger is lifted too.
Even though incoming events are interrupted, the event occurs.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.Hover
member.summary:
Hover events are a collection of points at a specific moment in time.
When a multi-event occurs, each point represents the points that are currently being hovered or the points where a hover has stopped.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Hover.#ctor
member.summary: The default constructor.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Hover.#ctor(System.UInt32)
member.summary: The constructor.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Hover.Time
member.summary: The time (in ms) that the hover event occurred.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Hover.GetDeviceId(System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Returns the ID of the device used for the point specified.
Each point has a unique device ID which specifies the device used for that point. This is returned by this method.
If a point is greater than GetPointCount(), then this method will return -1.
member.returns: The device ID of this point.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Hover.GetState(System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Retrieves the state of the point specified.
If a point is greater than GetPointCount(), then this method will return PointState.Finished.
member.returns: The state of the point specified.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Hover.GetHitView(System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Retrieves the view that was underneath the point specified.
If a point is greater than GetPointCount(), then this method will return an empty handle.
member.returns: The view that was underneath the point specified.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Hover.GetLocalPosition(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves the coordinates relative to the top-left of the hit-view at the point specified.
member.returns: The coordinates relative to the top-left of the hit-view of the point specified.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Hover.GetScreenPosition(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves the coordinates relative to the top-left of the screen of the point specified.
member.returns: The coordinates relative to the top-left of the screen of the point specified.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Hover.GetPointCount
member.summary: Returns the total number of points.
member.returns: Total number of points.

It means that the text editing has started.
If the hardware keyboard is not connected, then it shows the virtual keyboard.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.InputMethodContext.Deactivate
member.summary:
Deactivates the IMF.
It means that the text editing is complete.

member.summary:
Gets the restoration status, which controls if the keyboard is restored after the focus is lost and then regained.
If true, then the keyboard will be restored (activated) after the focus is regained.
member.returns: The restoration status.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.InputMethodContext.GetInputMethodArea
member.summary:
Provides the size and the position of the keyboard.
The position is relative to whether the keyboard is visible or not.
If the keyboard is not visible, then the position will be off the screen.
If the keyboard is not being shown when this method is called, the keyboard is partially setup (IMFContext) to get/> the values then taken down. So ideally, GetInputMethodArea() must be called after Show().
member.returns: Rectangle which is keyboard panel x, y, width, and height.

member.summary: Layers provide a mechanism for overlaying groups of actors on top of each other.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.Layer.LayerBehavior
member.summary: Enumeration for the behavior of the layer.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.Layer.LayerBehavior.LayerUI
member.summary:
UI control rendering mode (default mode). This mode is designed for UI controls that can overlap. In this mode renderer order will be respective to the tree hierarchy of Actors.
The rendering order is depth first, so for the following actor tree, A will be drawn first, then B, D, E, then C, F. This ensures that overlapping actors are drawn as expected (whereas, with breadth first traversal, the actors would interleave).

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.Layer.LayerBehavior.Layer2D
member.summary: Deprecated in API6; Will be removed in API9. Please use LayerUI instead.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.Layer.LayerBehavior.Layer3D
member.summary:
Layer will use depth test. This mode is designed for a 3 dimensional scene where actors in front of other actors will obscure them, i.e. the actors are sorted by the distance from the camera.
When using this mode, a depth test will be used. A depth clear will happen for each layer, which means actors in a layer "above" other layers will be rendered in front of actors in those layers regardless of their Z positions (see Layer::Raise() and Layer::Lower()).
Opaque renderers are drawn first and write to the depth buffer. Then transparent renderers are drawn with depth test enabled but depth write switched off. Transparent renderers are drawn based on their distance from the camera. A renderer's DEPTH_INDEX property is used to offset the distance to the camera when ordering transparent renderers. This is useful if you want to define the draw order of two or more transparent renderers that are equal distance from the camera. Unlike LAYER_UI, parent-child relationship does not affect rendering order at all.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.FlexLayout.SetFlexAlignmentSelf(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View,Tizen.NUI.FlexLayout.AlignmentType)
member.summary:
Sets the alignment self of the child view.
Alignment self has the same options and effect as but instead of affecting the children within a container, you can apply this property to a single child to change its alignment within its parent.
Alignment self overrides any option set by the parent with .
member.exception: The cannot be null.
The should be .

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.FlexLayout.SetFlexPositionType(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View,Tizen.NUI.FlexLayout.PositionType)
member.summary:
Sets the position type of the child view.
The position type of an element defines how it is positioned within its parent. By default a child is positioned relatively. This means a child is positioned according to the normal flow of the layout, and then offset relative to that position based on the values of .
When positioned absolutely an element doesn't take part in the normal layout flow. It is instead laid out independent of its siblings. The position is determined based on the .
member.exception: The cannot be null.
The should be .

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.FlexLayout.SetFlexAspectRatio(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View,System.Single)
member.summary:
Sets the aspect ratio of the child view. Aspect ratio Defines as the ratio between the width and the height of a node e.g. if a node has an aspect ratio of 2 then its width is twice the size of its height.
Aspect ratio accepts any floating point value > 0. this has higher priority than flex grow.
member.exception: The cannot be null.
The cannot be less than or equal to 0.0f.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.FlexLayout.SetFlexBasis(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View,System.Single)
member.summary:
Sets the flex basis of the child view. Flex basis is an axis-independent way of providing the default size of an item along the main axis.
Setting the flex basis of a child is similar to setting the width of that child if its parent is a container with or setting the height of a child if its parent is a container with .
The flex basis of an item is the default size of that item, the size of the item before any flex grow and flex shrink calculations are performed.
member.exception: The cannot be null.
The cannot be less than 0.0f.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.FlexLayout.SetFlexShrink(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View,System.Single)
member.summary:
Sets the flex shrink of the child view. Flex shrink describes how to shrink children along the main axis in the case that the total size of the children overflow the size of the container on the main axis.
Flex shrink is very similar to flex grow and can be thought of in the same way if any overflowing size is considered to be negative remaining space. These two properties also work well together by allowing children to grow and shrink as needed.
Flex shrink accepts any floating point value >= 0, with 1 being the default value. A container will shrink its children weighted by the child's flex shrink value.
member.exception: The cannot be null.
The cannot be less than 0.0f.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.FlexLayout.SetFlexGrow(Tizen.NUI.BaseComponents.View,System.Single)
member.summary:
Sets the grow of the child view. Flex grow describes how any space within a container should be distributed among its children along the main axis. After laying out its children, a container will distribute any remaining space according to the flex grow values specified by its children.
Flex grow accepts any floating point value >= 0, with 0 being the default value.
A container will distribute any remaining space among its children weighted by the child's flex grow value.
member.exception: The cannot be null.
The cannot be less than 0.0f.
