member.exception: Thrown when using invalid arguments that are enumerators.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.FlexLayout.Justification
member.summary:
Gets/Sets the justification in the layout. Justify content describes how to align children within the main axis of their container.
For example, you can use this property to center a child horizontally within a container with set to or vertically within a container with set to .
member.exception: Thrown when using invalid arguments that are enumerators.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.FlexLayout.WrapType
member.summary:
Gets/Sets the wrap in the layout. The flex wrap property is set on containers and controls what happens when children overflow the size of the container along the main axis.
By default children are forced into a single line (which can shrink elements).
If wrapping is allowed items are wrapped into multiple lines along the main axis if needed. wrap reverse behaves the same, but the order of the lines is reversed.
When wrapping lines can be used to specify how the lines are placed in the container.
member.exception: Thrown when using invalid arguments that are enumerators.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.FlexLayout.Alignment
member.summary:
Gets/Sets the alignment of the layout content. Alignment defines the distribution of lines along the cross-axis.
This only has effect when items are wrapped to multiple lines using flex wrap.
member.exception: Thrown when using invalid arguments that are enumerators.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.FlexLayout.ItemsAlignment
member.summary:
Gets/Sets the alignment of the layout items. Items alignment describes how to align children along the cross axis of their container.
Align items is very similar to but instead of applying to the main axis, align items applies to the cross axis.
member.exception: Thrown when using invalid arguments that are enumerators.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.LayoutItem.SuggestedMinimumWidth
member.summary:
Returns the suggested minimum width that the layout should use.
This returns the maximum of the layout's minimum width and the owner's natural width.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.LayoutItem.SuggestedMinimumHeight
member.summary:
Returns the suggested minimum height that the layout should use.
This returns the maximum of the layout's minimum height and the owner's natural height.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.LayoutItem.MinimumWidth
member.summary:
Sets the minimum width of the layout.
It is not guaranteed the layout will be able to achieve this minimum width (for example, if its parent layout constrains it with less available width).
1. if the owner's View.WidthSpecification has exact value, then that value overrides the minimum size.
2. If the owner's View.WidthSpecification is set to View.LayoutParamPolicies.WrapContent, then the view's width is set based on the suggested minimum width. (@see GetSuggestedMinimumWidth()).
3. If the owner's View.WidthSpecification is set to View.LayoutParamPolicies.MatchParent, then the parent width takes precedence over the minimum width.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.LayoutItem.MinimumHeight
member.summary:
Sets the minimum height of the layout.
It is not guaranteed the layout will be able to achieve this minimum height (for example, if its parent layout constrains it with less available height).
1. if the owner's View.HeightSpecification has exact value, then that value overrides the minimum size.
2. If the owner's View.HeightSpecification is set to View.LayoutParamPolicies.WrapContent, then the view's height is set based on the suggested minimum height. (@see GetSuggestedMinimumHeight()).
3. If the owner's View.HeightSpecification is set to View.LayoutParamPolicies.MatchParent, then the parent height takes precedence over the minimum height.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.LayoutItem.OnMeasure(Tizen.NUI.MeasureSpecification,Tizen.NUI.MeasureSpecification)
member.summary:
Measure the layout and its content to determine the measured width and the measured height.
The base class implementation of measure defaults to the background size, unless a larger size is allowed by the MeasureSpec. Subclasses should override to provide better measurements of their content.
If this method is overridden, it is the subclass's responsibility to make sure the measured height and width are at least the layout's minimum height and width.
member.param: horizontal space requirements as imposed by the parent.
vertical space requirements as imposed by the parent.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.LongPressGesture
member.summary:
A long press gesture is emitted when the user holds the screen with the stated number of fingers.
A long press gesture finishes when all touches have been released.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.LongPressGesture.#ctor(Tizen.NUI.Gesture.StateType)
member.summary: The constructor.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.LongPressGesture.NumberOfTouches
member.summary: The number of touch points in this long press gesture, i.e., the number of fingers the user had on the screen to generate the long press gesture.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.LongPressGesture.ScreenPoint
member.summary:
This is the point, in screen coordinates, where the long press occurred.
If a multi-touch long press, then this is the centroid of all the touch points.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.LongPressGesture.LocalPoint
member.summary:
This is the point, in local actor coordinates, where the long press occurred.
If a multi-touch long press, then this is the centroid of all the touch points.

members.member: This will not be public opened.

This class emits a signals when a long press gesture occurs that meets the requirements set by the application.
For any valid long press, two signals will be emitted:
- First identifying the beginning (state = Started) i.e. when fingers held down for the required time.
- Second identifying the ending (state = Finished) i.e. when fingers are released.
This will be public opened in tizen_5.0 after ACR done. Before ACR, need to be hidden as inhouse API.

This will be public opened in tizen_5.0 after ACR done. Before ACR, need to be hidden as inhouse API.

Creates an initialized LongPressGestureDetector with the number of touches required.
A long press gesture will be emitted from this detector if the number of fingers touching the screen is equal to the touches required.
The number of touches required. This will be public opened in tizen_5.0 after ACR done. Before ACR, need to be hidden as inhouse API.

Creates an initialized LongPressGestureDetector with the minimum and maximum number of touches required.
A long press gesture will be emitted from this detector if the number of fingers touching the screen falls between the minimum and maximum touches set.
The minimum number of touches required. The maximum number of touches required. This will be public opened in tizen_5.0 after ACR done. Before ACR, need to be hidden as inhouse API.

The number of touches corresponds to the number of fingers a user has on the screen. The default is 1.

members.member:
Sets the number of frames per render.
The number of vsyncs between successive renders.
Suggest this is a power of two: 1 - render each vsync frame. 2 - render every other vsync frame. 4 - render every fourth vsync frame. 8 - render every eighth vsync frame.
For example, if an application runs on 60 FPS and SetRenderRefreshRate(2) is called, the frames per second will be changed to 30.
This will be public opened in tizen_5.5 after ACR done. Before ACR, need to be hidden as inhouse API.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.ScrollModeType

member.summary: Whether the content can be scrolled along the X axis or not.

member.summary: When set, the scroll view is unable to scroll beyond the value of the boundary along the X axis.

member.summary: Whether the content can be scrolled along the Y axis or not.

member.summary: When set, causes scroll view to snap to multiples of the value of the interval while flicking along the Y axis.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.ScrollModeType.YAxisScrollBoundary
member.summary: When set, the scroll view is unable to scroll beyond the value of the boundary along the Y axis.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.ResizePolicyType
member.summary: Enumeration for size negotiation resize policies.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.ResizePolicyType.Fixed
member.summary: Size is fixed as set by SetSize.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.ResizePolicyType.UseNaturalSize
member.summary: Size is to use the actor's natural size.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.ResizePolicyType.FillToParent
member.summary: Size is to fill up to the actor's parent's bounds. Aspect ratio is not maintained.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.ResizePolicyType.SizeRelativeToParent
member.summary: The actors size will be ( ParentSize * SizeRelativeToParentFactor ).

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.ResizePolicyType.SizeFixedOffsetFromParent
member.summary: The actors size will be ( ParentSize + SizeRelativeToParentFactor ).

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.ResizePolicyType.FitToChildren
member.summary: The size will adjust to wrap around all children.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.ResizePolicyType.DimensionDependency
member.summary: One dimension is dependent on the other.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.ResizePolicyType.UseAssignedSize
member.summary: The size will be assigned to the actor.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.SizeScalePolicyType.UseSizeSet
member.summary: Use the size that was set.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.SizeScalePolicyType.FitWithAspectRatio
member.summary: Fit within the size set maintaining natural size aspect ratio.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.SizeScalePolicyType.FillWithAspectRatio
member.summary: Fit within the size set maintaining natural size aspect ratio.

member.summary: This actor will not clip its children.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.ClippingModeType.ClipChildren
member.summary: This actor will clip all children to within its boundaries (the actor will also be visible itself).

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.ClippingModeType.ClipToBoundingBox
member.summary: This Actor will clip all children within a screen-aligned rectangle encompassing its boundaries (the actor will also be visible itself).

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.PanGesture
member.summary:
A PanGesture is emitted when the user moves one or more fingers in a particular direction.
A pan gesture will end in the following ways:
- User releases the primary finger (the first touch).
- User has more fingers on the screen than the maximum specified.
- User has less fingers on the screen than the minimum specified.
- Cancelled by the system.
A pan gesture will continue to be sent to the actor under than initial pan until it ends.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.PanGesture.#ctor
member.summary: The default constructor.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.PanGesture.#ctor(Tizen.NUI.Gesture.StateType)
member.summary: The constructor.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PanGesture.Velocity
member.summary:
The velocity at which the user is moving their fingers.
This is represented as a Vector2 and is the pixel movement per millisecond.
A positive x value shows that the user is panning to the right, a negative x value means the opposite.
A positive y value shows that the user is panning downwards, a negative y values means upwards.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PanGesture.Displacement
member.summary:
This is a Vector2 showing how much the user has panned (dragged) since the last pan gesture or, if the gesture has just started, then the amount panned since the user touched the screen.
A positive x value shows that the user is panning to the right, a negative x value means the opposite.
A positive y value shows that the user is panning downwards, a negative y value means upwards.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PanGesture.Position
member.summary: The current touch position of the primary touch point in local actor coordinates.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PanGesture.ScreenVelocity
member.summary:
The velocity at which the user is moving their fingers.
This is represented as a Vector2 and is the pixel movement per millisecond.
A positive x value shows that the user is panning to the right, a negative x value means the opposite.
A positive y value shows that the user is panning downwards, a negative y values means upwards.
This value represents the screen coordinates.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PanGesture.ScreenDisplacement
member.summary:
This is a Vector2 showing how much the user has panned (dragged) since the last pan gesture or, if the gesture has just started, then the amount panned since the user touched the screen.
A positive x value shows that the user is panning to the right, a negative x value means the opposite.
A positive y value shows that the user is panning downwards, a negative y value means upwards.
This value is in screen coordinates.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PanGesture.ScreenPosition
member.summary: The current touch position of the primary touch point in screen coordinates.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PanGesture.NumberOfTouches
member.summary: The total number of fingers touching the screen in a pan gesture.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.PanGesture.GetSpeed
member.summary:
Returns the speed at which the user is moving their fingers.
This is the pixel movement per millisecond.
member.returns: The speed of the pan (in pixels per millisecond).

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.PanGesture.GetDistance
member.summary:
Returns the distance the user has panned (dragged) since the last pan gesture or, if the gesture has just started, then the distance moved since the user touched the screen.
This is always a positive value.
member.returns: The distance, as a float, a user's finger has panned.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.PanGesture.GetScreenSpeed
member.summary:
Returns the speed at which the user is moving their fingers relative to screen coordinates.
This is the pixel movement per millisecond.
member.returns: The speed of the pan (in pixels per millisecond).

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.PanGesture.GetScreenDistance
member.summary:
Returns the distance the user has panned (dragged) since the last pan gesture in screen coordinates or, if the gesture has just started, then the distance in screen coordinates moved since the user touched the screen.
This is always a positive value.
member.returns: The distance, as a float, a user's finger has panned.

The pan gesture is only emitted if the pan occurs in the direction specified by this method with a +/- threshold allowance.
If an angle of 0.0 degrees is specified and the threshold is 45 degrees then the acceptable direction range is from -45 to 45 degrees.
The angle added using this API is only checked when the gesture first starts, after that, this detector will emit the gesture regardless of what angle the pan is moving. The user can add as many angles as they require.
The angle that pan should be allowed The threshold around that angle This will be public opened in tizen_5.0 after ACR done. Before ACR, need to be hidden as inhouse API.

The pan gesture is only emitted if the pan occurs in the direction specified by this method with a +/- threshold allowance. The default threshold (PI * 0.25) is used.
The angle added using this API is only checked when the gesture first starts, after that, this detector will emit the gesture regardless of what angle the pan is moving.
The user can add as many angles as they require.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.Path
member.summary:
A 3D parametric curve.
Paths can be used to animate the position and orientation of actors.

member.summary: Creates an initialized path handle.

member.summary: Enumeration for the Points.

member.summary: Enumeration for the ControlPoints.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Path.AddPoint(Tizen.NUI.Position)
member.summary: Adds an interpolation point.
member.param: The new interpolation point to be added.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Path.AddControlPoint(Tizen.NUI.Vector3)
member.summary: Adds a control point.
member.param: The new control point to be added.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Path.GenerateControlPoints(System.Single)
member.summary:
Automatic generation of control points. Generated control points which result in a smooth join between the splines of each segment.
The generating algorithm is as follows:
For a given knot point K[N], find the vector that bisects K[N-1],[N] and [N],[N+1].
Calculate the tangent vector by taking the normal of this bisector.
The in control point is the length of the preceding segment back along this bisector multiplied by the curvature.
The out control point is the length of the succeeding segment forward along this bisector multiplied by the curvature.
member.param: The curvature of the spline. 0 gives straight lines between the knots, negative values means the spline contains loops, positive values up to 0.5 result in a smooth curve, positive values between 0.5 and 1 result in looped curves where the loops are not distinct (i.e., the curve appears to be non-continuous), positive values higher than 1 result in looped curves.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Path.Sample(System.Single,Tizen.NUI.Vector3,Tizen.NUI.Vector3)
member.summary: Sample path at a given progress. Calculates the position and tangent at that point of the curve.
member.param: A floating point value between 0.0 and 1.0.
The interpolated position at that progress.
The interpolated tangent at that progress.

member.summary: An accessor for the control points.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.PinchGesture
member.summary:
A PinchGesture is emitted when the user moves two fingers towards or away from each other.
A pinch gesture will continue to be sent to the actor under the center point of the pinch until the pinch ends.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PinchGesture.Scale
member.summary:
The scale factor from the start of the pinch gesture till the latest pinch gesture.
If the user is moving their fingers away from each other, then this value increases. Conversely, if the user is moving their fingers towards each other, this value will decrease.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PinchGesture.Speed
member.summary:
The speed at which the user is moving their fingers.
This is the pixel movement per second.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PinchGesture.ScreenCenterPoint
member.summary: The center point of the two points that caused the pinch gesture in screen coordinates.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PinchGesture.LocalCenterPoint
member.summary: The center point of the two points that caused the pinch gesture in local actor coordinates.

The PixelBuffer object holds a pixel buffer. The PixelBuffer keeps ownership of its initial buffer. However, the user is free to modify the pixel data, either directly or via image operations.
In order to upload the pixel data to the texture memory, there are two possibilities, either convert it back to a PixelData object, which releases the PixelBuffer object, leaving the user with an empty handle (ideal for one-time indirect image manipulation) or create a new PixelData object from this object, leaving the buffer intact (ideal for continuous manipulation).
5 This will be released at Tizen.NET API Level 5. Therefore, currently this would be used as an in-house API.

Create a PixelBuffer with its own data buffer.
The pixel buffer width. The pixel buffer height. The pixel format. 5 This will be released at Tizen.NET API Level 5. Therefore, currently this would be used as an in-house API.

Convert to a pixel data and release the object of the pixelBuffer. This handle is left empty. Any other handles that keep a reference to this object will be left with no buffer. Trying to access it will return NULL.
A pixel buffer. A new PixelData that takes ownership of the buffer of the pixelBuffer. 5 This will be released at Tizen.NET API Level 5. Therefore, currently this would be used as an in-house API.

Copy the data from this object into a new PixelData object, which could be used for uploading to a texture.
The pixel data. 5 This will be released at Tizen.NET API Level 5. Therefore, currently this would be used as an in-house API.

Gets the width of the buffer in pixels.
The width of the buffer in pixels. 5 This will be released at Tizen.NET API Level 5. Therefore, currently this would be used as an in-house API.

Gets the height of the buffer in pixels.
The height of the buffer in pixels. 5 This will be released at Tizen.NET API Level 5. Therefore, currently this would be used as an in-house API.

The pixel format. 5 This will be released at Tizen.NET API Level 5. Therefore, currently this would be used as an in-house API.

Apply the mask to this pixel data and return a new pixel data that contains the masked image. If this PixelBuffer does not have an alpha channel, then the resultant PixelBuffer will be converted to a format that supports at least the width of the color channels and the alpha channel from the mask.
If cropToMask is set to true, then the contentScale is applied first to this buffer, and the target buffer is cropped to the size of the mask. If it is set to false, then the mask is scaled to match the size of this buffer before the mask is applied.
The mask to apply. The scaling factor to apply to the content. Whether to crop the output to the mask size (true) or scale the mask to the content size (false). 5 This will be released at Tizen.NET API Level 5. Therefore, currently this would be used as an in-house API.

If cropToMask is set to true, then the contentScale is applied first to this buffer, and the target buffer is cropped to the size of the mask. If it is set to false, then the mask is scaled to match the size of this buffer before the mask is applied.

If cropToMask is set to true, then the contentScale is applied first to this buffer, and the target buffer is cropped to the size of the mask. If it is set to false, then the mask is scaled to match the size of this buffer before the mask is applied.

Apply a Gaussian blur to this pixel data with the given radius. A bigger radius will yield a blurrier image. Only works for pixel data in RGBA format.
The radius for Gaussian blur. A value of 0 or negative value indicates no blur. 5 This will be released at Tizen.NET API Level 5. Therefore, currently this would be used as an in-house API.

Crops this buffer to the given crop rectangle.
The top left corner's X. The top left corner's Y. The crop width. The crop height. 5 This will be released at Tizen.NET API Level 5. Therefore, currently this would be used as an in-house API.

Resizes the buffer to the given dimensions.
The new width. The new height. 5 This will be released at Tizen.NET API Level 5. Therefore, currently this would be used as an in-house API.

Rotate the buffer by the given angle.
The angle in degrees. 8 This will be public opened in tizen_6.0 after ACR done. Before ACR, need to be hidden as inhouse API.

Gets the pixel buffer
8 This will be public opened in tizen_6.0 after ACR done. Before ACR, need to be hidden as inhouse API.
This will not be public opened.

The PixelData object holds a pixel buffer.
The PixelData takes over the ownership of the pixel buffer.
The buffer memory must not be released outside of this class, instead, the PixelData object will release it automatically when the reference count falls to zero.
Please DO NOT use! This will be deprecated! PixelData class requires externally allocated pixel memory buffer and this buffer loses its ownershop by native DALi. And this would make some problem, because dotnet runtime would change the address of memory allocated. So this is required to be removed. currently no use. will be added later 5 This will be released at Tizen.NET API Level 5, so currently this would be used as inhouse API.

Creates a PixelData object.
The raw pixel data. The size of the buffer in bytes. Buffer width in pixels. Buffer height in pixels. The pixel format. The function used to release the memory. 5 This will be released at Tizen.NET API Level 5, so currently this would be used as inhouse API.

Enumeration for function to release the pixel buffer.
5 This will be released at Tizen.NET API Level 5, so currently this would be used as inhouse API.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.Position
member.summary: Position is a three-dimensional vector.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Position.#ctor
member.summary: The constructor.
member.remarks:
Position2D and Position are implicitly converted to each other, so these are compatible and can be replaced without any type casting.
For example, the followings are possible.
view.Position2D = new Position(10.0f, 10.0f, 10.0f); // be aware that here the z value(10.0f) will be lost.
view.Position = new Position2D(10, 10); // be aware that here the z value is 0.0f by default.

view.Position = new Position2D(10, 10); // be aware that here the z value is 0.0f by default.

A RotationGesture is emitted when the user moves two fingers in a circular motion.
A rotation gesture will continue to be sent to the actor under the center point of the rotation until the rotation ends.

ScrollView Page Path Effect. This effect causes Views to follow a given path. The opacity of the view will be 0.0 at the beginning of the path and will go to 1.0 as it is approximating to half of the path to return to 0.0 at the end of the path.
This will be public opened in next tizen after ACR done. Before ACR, need to be hidden as inhouse API.
This will not be public opened.

Creates an initialized ScrollViewPagePathEffect.
The path that will be used by the scroll effect. Vector in page object space which will be aligned with the tangent of the path. Index of a property of the scroll-view which will be used as the input for the path. Size of a page in the scrollview. Total number of pages in the scrollview. member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.Size
member.summary: A three-dimensional size.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Size.#ctor
member.summary: The constructor.
member.remarks:
Size2D and Size are implicitly converted to each other, so these are compatible and can be replaced without any type casting.
For example, the followings are possible.
view.Size2D = new Size(10.0f, 10.0f, 10.0f); // be aware that here the depth value(10.0f) will be lost.
view.Size = new Size2D(10, 10); // be aware that here the depth value is 0.0f by default.
view.MinimumSize = new Size(10, 10, 0);
Size Tmp = view.MaximumSize; //here Tmp.Depth will be 0.0f.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.StyleManager
member.summary:
The StyleManager informs applications of the system theme change, and supports application theme change at runtime.
Applies various styles to controls using the properties system.
On theme change, it automatically updates all controls, then raises a event to inform the application.
If the application wants to customize the theme, RequestThemeChange needs to be called.
It provides the path to the application resource root folder, from there the filename can be specified along with any subfolders, for example, Images, Models, etc.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.StyleManager.#ctor
member.summary:
Creates a StyleManager handle.
This can be initialized with StyleManager::Get().

member.name: E:Tizen.NUI.StyleManager.StyleChanged
member.summary:
An event for the StyleChanged signal which can be used to subscribe or unsubscribe the event handler provided by the user.
The StyleChanged signal is emitted after the style (for example, theme or font change) has changed and the controls have been informed.

member.summary: Gets the singleton of the StyleManager object.

member.returns: A handle to the StyleManager control.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.StyleManager.ApplyTheme(System.String)
member.summary:
Applies a new theme to the application.
This will be merged on the top of the default Toolkit theme.
If the application theme file doesn't style all controls that the application uses, then the default Toolkit theme will be used instead for those controls.
member.param: A relative path is specified for style theme.

This class emits a signal when a tap gesture occurs that meets the requirements set by the application.
A TapGesture is a discrete gesture, which means it does not have any state information attached.
This will be public opened in tizen_5.0 after ACR done. Before ACR, need to be hidden as inhouse API.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.Timer
member.summary:
Mechanism to issue simple periodic or one-shot events.
Timer is provided for application developers to be able to issue simple periodic or one-shot events. Please note that the timer callback functions should return as soon as possible because they block the next SignalTick. Please note that timer signals are not in sync with DALi's render timer.
This class is a handle class so it can be stack allocated and used as a member.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.Touch
member.summary:
Touch events are a collection of points at a specific moment in time.
When a multi-touch event occurs, each point represents the points that are currently being touched or the points where a touch has stopped.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Touch.#ctor
member.summary:
An uninitialized touch instance.
Calling member functions with an uninitialized touch handle is not allowed.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Touch.GetTime
member.summary: Returns the time (in ms) that the touch event occurred.
member.returns: The time (in ms) that the touch event occurred.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Touch.GetPointCount
member.summary: Returns the total number of points in this TouchData.
member.returns: The total number of points.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Touch.GetDeviceId(System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Returns the ID of the device used for the point specified.
Each point has a unique device ID, which specifies the device used for that point. This is returned by this method.
If a point is greater than GetPointCount(), then this method will return -1.
member.returns: The device ID of this point.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Touch.GetState(System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Retrieves the state of the point specified.
If a point is greater than GetPointCount(), then this method will return PointState.Finished.
member.returns: The state of the point specified.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Touch.GetHitView(System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Retrieves the actor that was underneath the point specified.
If a point is greater than GetPointCount(), then this method will return an empty handle.
member.returns: The actor that was underneath the point specified.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Touch.GetLocalPosition(System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Retrieves the coordinates relative to the top-left of the hit actor at the point specified.
The top-left of an actor is (0.0, 0.0, 0.5).
If you require the local coordinates of another actor (for example, the parent of the hit actor), then you should use Actor::ScreenToLocal().
If a point is greater than GetPointCount(), then this method will return Vector2.Zero.
member.returns: The coordinates relative to the top-left of the hit actor of the point specified.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Touch.GetScreenPosition(System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Retrieves the coordinates relative to the top-left of the screen of the point specified.
If a point is greater than GetPointCount(), then this method will return Vector2.Zero.
member.returns: The coordinates relative to the top-left of the screen of the point specified.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Touch.GetRadius(System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Retrieves the radius of the press point.
This is the average of both the horizontal and vertical radii of the press point.
If point is greater than GetPointCount(), then this method will return 0.0f.
member.returns: The radius of the press point.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Touch.GetEllipseRadius(System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Retrieves both the horizontal and the vertical radii of the press point.
If a point is greater than GetPointCount(), then this method will return Vector2.Zero.
member.returns: The horizontal and vertical radii of the press point.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Touch.GetPressure(System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Retrieves the touch pressure.
The pressure range starts at 0.0f.
Normal pressure is defined as 1.0f.
A value between 0.0f and 1.0f means light pressure has been applied.
A value greater than 1.0f means more pressure than normal has been applied.
If point is greater than GetPointCount(), then this method will return 1.0f.
member.returns: The touch pressure.

The Button class is a base class for different kinds of buttons.
This class provides the disabled property and the clicked signal.
The clicked event handler is emitted when the button is touched, and the touch point doesn't leave the boundary of the button.
When the disabled property is set to true, no signal is emitted.
The 'Visual' describes not just traditional images like PNG and BMP, but also refers to whatever is used to show the button. It could be a color, gradient, or some other kind of renderer.
The button's appearance can be modified by setting properties for the various visuals or images.
It is not mandatory to set all the visuals. A button could be defined only by setting its background visual, or by setting its background and selected visuals.
The button visual is shown over the background visual.
When pressed, the unselected visuals are replaced by the selected visuals.
The text label is always placed on the top of all images.
When the button is disabled, the background button and the selected visuals are replaced by their disabled visuals.

The CheckBoxButton provides a checkbox button which the user can check or uncheck.
By default, the CheckBoxButton emits a Button.Clicked event when the button changes its state to selected or unselected.
The button's appearance could be modified by Button.UnselectedImage, Button.BackgroundImage, Button.SelectedImage, Button.SelectedBackgroundImage, Button.DisabledBackgroundImage, Button.DisabledImage, and Button.DisabledSelectedImage.
When the button is not disabled, if it's not selected, it only shows the background image.
The selected image is shown over the background image when the box is selected (background image is not replaced by \e selected image).
When the button is disabled, the background image and the selected image are replaced by disabled images.

Sets the display state of popup.
There are 4 total display states.
Only 2 can be set, but all four can be read for better inspection of the current popup state.
The other two states are getable, but not setable, and are there for consistency.
| Value | Setting the state | Getting the state |
|----------|--------------------------------|--------------------------------|
| SHOWN | Show the popup | The popup is fully shown |
| HIDDEN | Hide the popup | The popup is fully hidden |
| SHOWING | | The popup is transitioning in |
| HIDING | | The popup is transitioning out |
All 4 states changes cause notifications via 4 respective signals that can be connected to.
The desired display state to change to. 3 This will be deprecated

A RadioButton provides a radio button with two states, \e selected or \e unselected.
Radio buttons are designed to select one of the many options at the same time.
A RadioButton can change its current state using the selected.
RadioButtons can be grouped.
Two or more RadioButtons are in one group when they have this same parent.
In each groups only one RadioButton can be \e selected at a given time.
So when a RadioButton is set to \e selected, other RadioButtons in its group are set to \e unselected.
When \e selected RadioButton is set to \e unselected, no other RadioButtons in this group are set to \e selected.
The StateChanged event is emitted when the RadioButton change its state to \e selected or \e unselected.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.VisualBase
member.summary:
Sets whether the actor should be focusable by keyboard navigation.
Visuals reuse geometry, shader etc. across controls. They ensure that the renderer and texture sets exist only when control is on window.
Each visual also responds to actor size and color change, and provides clipping at the renderer level.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.VisualBase.GetNaturalSize(Tizen.NUI.Size2D)
member.summary:
Returns the natural size of the visual.
Deriving classes stipulate the natural size and by default a visual has a zero natural size.
A visual may not actually have a natural size until it has been placed on window and acquired all it's resources.

member.summary: Load texture once the image source has been provided. Even if not being used yet.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.LoadPolicyType.Attached
member.summary: Only load texture once the visual is attached, when the image needs to be shown.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.WrapModeType
member.summary:
This specifies wrap mode types.
WrapModeU and WrapModeV separately decide how the texture should be sampled when the u and v coordinate exceeds the range of 0.0 to 1.0.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.WrapModeType.Default
member.summary: The default value.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.WrapModeType.ClampToEdge
member.summary: Clamp to edge.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.WrapModeType.Repeat
member.summary: Repeat.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.WrapModeType.MirroredRepeat
member.summary: Mirrored repeat.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.FittingModeType
member.summary:
This specifies fitting mode types. Fitting options, used when resizing images to fit desired dimensions.
A fitting mode controls the region of a loaded image to be mapped to the desired image rectangle.
All fitting modes preserve the aspect ratio of the image contents.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.FittingModeType.ShrinkToFit
member.summary: Full-screen image display: Limit loaded image resolution to device resolution using the ShrinkToFit mode.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.FittingModeType.ScaleToFill
member.summary: Thumbnail gallery grid: Limit loaded image resolution to screen tile using the ScaleToFill mode.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.FittingModeType.FitWidth
member.summary: Image columns: Limit loaded image resolution to column width using the FitWidth mode.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.FittingModeType.FitHeight
member.summary: Image rows: Limit loaded image resolution to row height using the FitHeight mode.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.FittingModeType.Center
member.summary: Thumbnail gallery grid: Limit loaded image resolution to screen tile using the Center mode.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.FittingModeType.Fill
member.summary: Thumbnail gallery grid: Limit loaded image resolution to screen tile using the ScaleToFill mode.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.SamplingModeType
member.summary:
This specifies sampling mode types. Filtering options are used when resizing images to sample original pixels.
A SamplingMode controls how pixels in an input image are sampled and combined to generate each pixel of a destination image during scaling.
NoFilter and Box modes do not guarantee that the output pixel array exactly matches the rectangle specified by the desired dimensions and the FittingMode,
but all other filter modes do if the desired dimensions are not more than the raw dimensions of the input image file.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.SamplingModeType.Box
member.summary:
Iteratively box filter to generate an image of 1/2, 1/4, 1/8, etc. width and height and approximately the desired size.
This is the default.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.SamplingModeType.Nearest
member.summary: For each output pixel, read one input pixel.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.SamplingModeType.Linear
member.summary: For each output pixel, read a quad of four input pixels and write a weighted average of them.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.SamplingModeType.BoxThenNearest
member.summary:
Iteratively box filter to generate an image of 1/2, 1/4, 1/8, etc. width and height and approximately the desired size,
then for each output pixel, read one pixel from the last level of box filtering.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.SamplingModeType.BoxThenLinear
member.summary: Iteratively box filter to almost the right size, then for each output pixel, read four pixels from the last level of box filtering and write their weighted average.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.SamplingModeType.NoFilter
member.summary: No filtering is performed. If the SCALE_TO_FILL scaling mode is enabled, the borders of the image may be trimmed to match the aspect ratio of the desired dimensions.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.SamplingModeType.DontCare
member.summary: For caching algorithms where a client strongly prefers a cache-hit to reuse a cached image.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.GradientVisualUnitsType
member.summary: The type of coordinate system for certain attributes of the points in a gradient.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.GradientVisualUnitsType.ObjectBoundingBox
member.summary: Uses the normals for the start, end, and center points, i.e., top-left is (-0.5, -0.5) and bottom-right is (0.5, 0.5).

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.GradientVisualUnitsType.UserSpace
member.summary: Uses the user coordinates for the start, end, and center points, i.e., in a 200 by 200 control, top-left is (0, 0) and bottom-right is (200, 200).

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.GradientVisualSpreadMethodType
member.summary:
This specifies SpreadMethod types.
SpreadMethod defines what happens if the gradient starts or ends inside the bounds of the target rectangle.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.GradientVisualSpreadMethodType.Pad
member.summary: Uses the terminal colors of the gradient to fill the remainder of the quad.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.GradientVisualSpreadMethodType.Reflect
member.summary: Reflects the gradient pattern start-to-end, end-to-start, start-to-end, etc. until the quad is filled.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.GradientVisualSpreadMethodType.Repeat
member.summary: Repeats the gradient pattern start-to-end, start-to-end, start-to-end, etc. until the quad is filled.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.MeshVisualShadingModeValue
member.summary: The shading mode used by the mesh visual.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.MeshVisualShadingModeValue.TexturelessWithDiffuseLighting
member.summary: *Simplest*. One color that is lit by ambient and diffuse lighting.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.MeshVisualShadingModeValue.TexturedWithSpecularLighting
member.summary: Uses only the visual image textures provided with specular lighting in addition to ambient and diffuse lighting.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.MeshVisualShadingModeValue.TexturedWithDetailedSpecularLighting
member.summary: Uses all textures provided including gloss, normal, and texture map along with specular, ambient, and diffuse lighting.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.PrimitiveVisualShapeType
member.summary: The primitive shape to render as a primitive visual.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.PrimitiveVisualShapeType.Sphere
member.summary: A perfectly round geometrical object in the three-dimensional space.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.PrimitiveVisualShapeType.ConicalFrustrum
member.summary: The area bound between two circles, i.e., a cone with the tip removed.

members.member: Equivalent to a conical frustrum with the top radius of zero. Equivalent to a conical frustrum with the top radius of zero.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.PrimitiveVisualShapeType.Cylinder
member.summary: Equivalent to a conical frustrum with the top radius of zero.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.PrimitiveVisualShapeType.Cube
member.summary: Equivalent to a conical frustrum with equal radii for the top and bottom circles.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.PrimitiveVisualShapeType.Octahedron
member.summary: Equivalent to a bevelled cube with a bevel percentage of zero.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.PrimitiveVisualShapeType.BevelledCube
member.summary: Equivalent to a bevelled cube with a bevel percentage of one.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.VisualFittingModeType
member.summary: The values of this enum determine how the visual should fit into the view.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.VisualFittingModeType.FitKeepAspectRatio
member.summary: The visual should be scaled to fit, preserving aspect ratio.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.VisualFittingModeType.Fill
member.summary: The visual should be stretched to fill, not preserving aspect ratio.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.VisualFittingModeType.OverFitKeepAspectRatio
member.summary: The visual should be scaled to fit, preserving aspect ratio. The visual will be fillled without empty area, and outside is cropped away.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.VisualFittingModeType.Center
member.summary: The visual should keep original size of image. it is not scaled and not strecthed.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.VisualFittingModeType.FitHeight
member.summary: The visual should be scaled to fit, preserving aspect ratio. Height is scaled proportionately to maintain aspect ratio.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.VisualFittingModeType.FitWidth
member.summary: The visual should be scaled to fit, preserving aspect ratio. WIDTH is scaled proportionately to maintain aspect ratio.

member.remarks: The value is float type.
The property of optional. The default value is 0.

member.remarks: The value is float type.
The property of optional. The default value is 360.

member.name: F:Tizen.NUI.ArcVisualProperty.Cap
member.summary: The cap style of the arc.
member.remarks: The value is integer type. The value 0 means butt, the arc does not extend beyond its two endpoints. The value 1 means round, the arc will be extended by a half circle with the center at the end.
The property of optional. The default value is 0 (butt).

member.summary:
Gets or sets the size of the visual.
It can be either relative (percentage of the parent) or absolute (in world units).
Optional.

member.summary:
Gets or sets the offset of the visual.
It can be either relative (percentage of the parent) or absolute (in world units).
Optional.

member.summary:
Gets or sets the relative size of the visual
(percentage [0.0f to 1.0f] of the control).
Optional.

member.summary:
Gets or sets the relative offset of the visual
(percentage [0.0f to 1.0f] of the control).
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.VisualMap.PositionPolicy
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether the x and y offset values are relative
(percentage [0.0f to 1.0f] of the control) or absolute (in world units).
By default, both the x and the y offset are relative.
Optional.

member.summary:
Gets or sets whether the x offset values are relative
(percentage [0.0f to 1.0f] of the control) or absolute (in world units).
By default, the x offset is relative.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.VisualMap.PositionPolicyY
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether the y offset values are relative
(percentage [0.0f to 1.0f] of the control) or absolute (in world units).
By default, the y offset is relative.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.VisualMap.SizePolicy
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether the size values of the width or the height are relative
(percentage [0.0f to 1.0f] of the control) or absolute (in world units).
By default, offsets of both the width and the height are relative to the control's size.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.VisualMap.SizePolicyWidth
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether size values of the width are relative.
(percentage [0.0f to 1.0f] of the control) or absolute (in world units).
By default, the value of the width is relative to the control's width.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.VisualMap.SizePolicyHeight
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether size values of the height are relative
(percentage [0.0f to 1.0f] of the control) or absolute (in world units).
By default, the height value is relative to the control's height.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.VisualMap.Origin
member.summary:
Gets or sets the origin of the visual within its control area.
By default, the origin is center.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.VisualMap.AnchorPoint
member.summary:
Gets or sets the anchor point of the visual.
By default, the anchor point is center.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.VisualMap.DepthIndex
member.summary:
Gets or sets the depth index of the visual.
By default, the depth index is 0.
Optional.

member.summary: Gets the property map to create the visual.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.VisualMap.Shader

member.summary: A class encapsulating the property map of the image visual.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ImageVisual.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.ImageVisual.URL
member.summary:
Gets or sets the URL of the image.
Mandatory.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.ImageVisual.AlphaMaskURL
member.summary:
Gets or sets the URL of the alpha mask.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.ImageVisual.AuxiliaryImageURL
member.summary: Overlays the auxiliary image on top of an NPatch image. The resulting visual image will be at least as large as the smallest possible n-patch or the auxiliary image, whichever is larger.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.ImageVisual.FittingMode
member.summary:
Gets or sets fitting options used when resizing images to fit the desired dimensions.
If not supplied, the default is FittingModeType.ShrinkToFit.
For normal quad images only.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.ImageVisual.SamplingMode
member.summary:
Gets or sets filtering options used when resizing images to the sample original pixels.
If not supplied, the default is SamplingModeType.Box.
For normal quad images only.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.ImageVisual.DesiredWidth
member.summary:
Gets or sets the desired image width.
If not specified, the actual image width is used.
For normal quad images only.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.ImageVisual.DesiredHeight
member.summary:
Gets or sets the desired image height.
If not specified, the actual image height is used.
For normal quad images only.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.ImageVisual.SynchronousLoading
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether to load the image synchronously.
If not specified, the default is false, i.e., the image is loaded asynchronously.
For normal quad images only.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.ImageVisual.BorderOnly
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether to draw the borders only (If true).
If not specified, the default is false.
For n-patch images only.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.ImageVisual.PixelArea
member.summary:
Gets or sets the image area to be displayed.
It is a rectangular area.
The first two elements indicate the top-left position of the area, and the last two elements are the areas of the width and the height respectively.
If not specified, the default value is Vector4 (0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 1.0), i.e., the entire area of the image.
For normal quad images only.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.ImageVisual.WrapModeU
member.summary:
Gets or sets the wrap mode for the u coordinate.
It decides how the texture should be sampled when the u coordinate exceeds the range of 0.0 to 1.0.
If not specified, the default is WrapModeType.Default(CLAMP).
For normal quad images only.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.ImageVisual.WrapModeV
member.summary:
Gets or sets the wrap mode for the v coordinate.
It decides how the texture should be sampled when the v coordinate exceeds the range of 0.0 to 1.0.
The first two elements indicate the top-left position of the area, and the last two elements are the areas of the width and the height respectively.
If not specified, the default is WrapModeType.Default(CLAMP).
For normal quad images only. Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.ImageVisual.MaskContentScale
member.summary: Gets or sets scale factor to apply to the content image before masking.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.ImageVisual.CropToMask
member.summary: Whether to crop image to mask or scale mask to fit image.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.ImageVisual.AuxiliaryImageAlpha
member.summary: An alpha value for mixing between the masked main NPatch image and the auxiliary image.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.ImageVisual.ReleasePolicy
member.summary:
Gets or sets the Image Visual release policy.
It decides if a texture should be released from the cache or kept to reduce the loading time.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.ImageVisual.LoadPolicy
member.summary:
Gets or sets the Image Visual image loading policy.
It decides if a texture should be loaded immediately after source set or only after the visual is added to the window.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.ImageVisual.OrientationCorrection
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether to automatically correct the orientation based on the Exchangeable Image File (EXIF) data.
If not specified, the default is true.
For JPEG images only.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.ImageVisual.Atlasing
member.summary: Whether to use the texture atlas or not. Optional. By default atlasing is off.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.ImageVisual.ComposingPropertyMap
member.summary: Compose the out visual map.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.MeshVisual
member.summary: A class encapsulating the property map of the mesh visual.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.MeshVisual.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.MeshVisual.ObjectURL
member.summary:
Gets or sets the location of the ".obj" file.
Mandatory.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.MeshVisual.MaterialtURL
member.summary:
Gets or sets the location of the ".mtl" file.
If not specified, then a textureless object is assumed.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.MeshVisual.TexturesPath
member.summary:
Gets or sets the path to the directory the textures (including gloss and normal) are stored in.
Mandatory if using material.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.MeshVisual.ShadingMode
member.summary:
Gets or sets the type of shading mode that the mesh will use.
If anything the specified shading mode requires is missing, a simpler mode that can be handled with what has been supplied will be used instead.
If not specified, it will use the best it can support (will try MeshVisualShadingModeValue.TexturedWithDetailedSpecularLighting first).
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.MeshVisual.UseMipmapping
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether to use mipmaps for textures or not.
If not specified, the default is true.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.MeshVisual.UseSoftNormals
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether to average normals at each point to smooth textures or not.
If not specified, the default is true.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.MeshVisual.LightPosition
member.summary:
Gets or sets the position, in the stage space, of the point light that applies lighting to the model.
This is based off the stage's dimensions, so using the width and the height of the stage halved will correspond to the center, and using all zeroes will place the light at the top-left corner.
If not specified, the default is an offset outwards from the center of the screen.
Optional.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.MeshVisual.ComposingPropertyMap
member.summary: Compose the out visual map.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.PrimitiveVisual
member.summary: A class encapsulating the property map of the primetive visual.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.PrimitiveVisual.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PrimitiveVisual.Shape
member.summary:
Gets or sets the specific shape to render.
If not specified, the default is PrimitiveVisualShapeType.Sphere.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PrimitiveVisual.MixColor
member.summary:
Gets or sets the color of the shape.
If not specified, the default is Color (0.5, 0.5, 0.5, 1.0).
Applies to all shapes.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PrimitiveVisual.Slices
member.summary:
Gets or sets the number of slices as you go around the shape.
For spheres and conical frustrums, this determines how many divisions there are as you go around the object.
If not specified, the default is 128.
The range is from 1 to 255.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PrimitiveVisual.Stacks
member.summary:
Gets or sets the number of stacks as you go down the shape.
For spheres, 'stacks' determines how many layers there are as you go down the object.
If not specified, the default is 128.
The range is from 1 to 255.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PrimitiveVisual.ScaleTopRadius
member.summary:
Gets or sets the scale of the radius of the top circle of a conical frustrum.
If not specified, the default is 1.0f.
Applies to: - PrimitiveVisualShapeType.ConicalFrustrum
Only values greater than or equal to 0.0f are accepted.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PrimitiveVisual.ScaleBottomRadius
member.summary:
Gets or sets the scale of the radius of the bottom circle of a conical frustrum.
If not specified, the default is 1.5f.
Applies to: - PrimitiveVisualShapeType.ConicalFrustrum
- PrimitiveVisualShapeType.Cone
Only values greater than or equal to 0.0f are accepted.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PrimitiveVisual.ScaleHeight
member.summary:
Gets or sets the scale of the height of a conic.
If not specified, the default is 3.0f.
Applies to:
- PrimitiveVisualShapeType.ConicalFrustrum
- PrimitiveVisualShapeType.Cone
- PrimitiveVisualShapeType.Cylinder
Only values greater than or equal to 0.0f are accepted.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PrimitiveVisual.ScaleRadius
member.summary:
Gets or sets the scale of the radius of a cylinder.
If not specified, the default is 1.0f.
Applies to:
- PrimitiveVisualShapeType.Cylinder
Only values greater than or equal to 0.0f are accepted.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PrimitiveVisual.ScaleDimensions
member.summary:
Gets or sets the dimensions of a cuboid. Scales in the same fashion as a 9-patch image.
If not specified, the default is Vector3.One.
Applies to:
- PrimitiveVisualShapeType.Cube
- PrimitiveVisualShapeType.Octahedron
- PrimitiveVisualShapeType.BevelledCube
Each Vector3 parameter should be greater than or equal to 0.0f.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PrimitiveVisual.BevelPercentage
member.summary:
Gets or sets determines how bevelled the cuboid should be, based off the smallest dimension.
Bevel percentage ranges from 0.0 to 1.0. It affects the ratio of the outer face widths to the width of the overall cube.
If not specified, the default is 0.0f (no bevel).
Applies to:
- PrimitiveVisualShapeType.BevelledCube
The range is from 0.0f to 1.0f.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PrimitiveVisual.BevelSmoothness
member.summary:
Gets or sets descriptions of how smooth the bevelled edges should be.
If not specified, the default is 0.0f (sharp edges).
Applies to:
- PrimitiveVisualShapeType.BevelledCube
The range is from 0.0f to 1.0f.
Optional.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.PrimitiveVisual.LightPosition
member.summary:
Gets or sets the position, in the stage space, of the point light that applies lighting to the model.
This is based off the stage's dimensions, so using the width and the height of the stage halved will correspond to the center, and using all zeroes will place the light at the top-left corner.
If not specified, the default is an offset outwards from the center of the screen.
Applies to all shapes.
Optional.

member.summary: Compose the out visual map.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.WatchTime
member.summary:
The WatchTime class is used to get time for the WatchApplication.
A WatchTime has a time handle from watch application framework.
You can get time(hour, minute, second, millisecond) and date(year, month, day)
on receiving timeTick signal.

member.remarks: The return value is always positive.The WatchTime needs to be initialized.

If you want to see more information, please refer to the site :
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones/

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.Wheel
member.summary:
The wheel event structure is used to store a wheel rolling, it facilitates processing of the wheel rolling and passing to other libraries like Toolkit.
There is a key modifier which relates to keys like Alt, Shift, and Ctrl functions are supplied to check if they have been pressed when the wheel is being rolled.
We support a mouse device and there may be another custom device that support the wheel event. The device type is specified as \e type.
The mouse wheel event can be sent to the specific actor but the custom wheel event will be sent to the window.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Wheel.#ctor
member.summary: The default constructor.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Wheel.#ctor(Tizen.NUI.Wheel.WheelType,System.Int32,System.UInt32,Tizen.NUI.Vector2,System.Int32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: The constructor.
member.param: The type of the wheel event.
The direction of wheel rolling (0 = default vertical wheel, 1 = horizontal wheel).
Modifier keys pressed during the event (such as Shift, Alt, and Ctrl).
The coordinates of the cursor relative to the top-left of the screen.
The offset of rolling (positive value means roll down or clockwise, and negative value means roll up or counter-clockwise).
The time the wheel is being rolled.

member.name: T:Tizen.NUI.Wheel.WheelType
member.summary: The type of the wheel event.

member.summary: Mouse wheel event.

member.summary: Custom wheel event.

member.summary: The type of the wheel event.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Wheel.Direction
member.summary: The direction of wheel rolling (0 = default vertical wheel, 1 = horizontal wheel).

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Wheel.Modifiers
member.summary: Modifier keys pressed during the event (such as Shift, Alt, and Ctrl).

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Wheel.Point
member.summary: The coordinates of the cursor relative to the top-left of the screen.

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Wheel.Z
member.summary: The offset of rolling (positive value means roll down or clockwise, and negative value means roll up or counter-clockwise).

member.name: P:Tizen.NUI.Wheel.TimeStamp
member.summary: The time the wheel is being rolled.

member.summary: Checks to see if the Shift key modifier has been supplied.
member.returns: True if Shift modifier.

member.summary: Checks to see if Ctrl (control) key modifier has been supplied.
member.returns: True if Ctrl modifier.

member.summary: Checks to see if Alt key modifier has been supplied.
member.returns: True if Alt modifier.

Input events that the WidgetView gets are delivered to the widget.

member.name: E:Tizen.NUI.WidgetView.WidgetAdded
member.summary:
An event for the ResourceReady signal which can be used to subscribe or unsubscribe the event handler.
This signal is emitted after all resources required by a control are loaded and ready.
Most resources are only loaded when the control is placed on the stage.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Window.SetOpaqueState(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Sets a transparent window's visual state to opaque.
If a visual state of a transparent window is opaque,
then the window manager could handle it as an opaque window when calculating visibility.
member.param: Whether the window's visual state is opaque.
member.remarks:
This will have no effect on an opaque window.
It doesn't change transparent window to opaque window but lets the window manager know the visual state of the window.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Window.IsOpaqueState
member.summary: Returns whether a transparent window's visual state is opaque or not.
member.returns: True if the window's visual state is opaque, false otherwise.
member.remarks: The return value has no meaning on an opaque window.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Window.GrabKeyTopmost(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Grabs the key specified by a key for a window only when a window is the topmost window.
This function can be used for following example scenarios:
- Mobile - Using volume up or down as zoom up or down in camera apps.
member.returns: True if the grab succeeds.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Window.UngrabKeyTopmost(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Ungrabs the key specified by a key for the window.
Note: If this function is called between key down and up events of a grabbed key, an application doesn't receive the key up event.
member.returns: True if the ungrab succeeds.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Window.GrabKey(System.Int32,Tizen.NUI.Window.KeyGrabMode)
member.summary:
Grabs the key specified by a key for a window in a GrabMode.
Details: This function can be used for following example scenarios:
- TV - A user might want to change the volume or channel of the background TV contents while focusing on the foregrund app.
- Mobile - When a user presses the Home key, the homescreen appears regardless of the current foreground app.
- Mobile - Using the volume up or down as zoom up or down in camera apps.
member.param: The grab mode for the key.
member.returns: True if the grab succeeds.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Window.UngrabKey(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Ungrabs the key specified by a key for a window.
Note: If this function is called between key down and up events of a grabbed key, an application doesn't receive the key up event.
member.returns: True if the ungrab succeeds.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Window.SetParent(Tizen.NUI.Window)
member.summary: Sets parent window of the window. After setting that, these windows do together when raise-up, lower and iconified/deiconified. Initially, the window is located on top of the parent. The window can go below parent by calling Lower(). If parent's window stack is changed by calling Raise() or Lower(), child windows are located on top of the parent again.
member.exception: The required feature is not supported.

member.name: M:Tizen.NUI.Window.AddFrameRenderedCallback(Tizen.NUI.Window.FrameCallbackType,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Adds a callback that is called when the frame rendering is done by the graphics driver. A callback of the following type may be used:
void MyFunction( int frameId )

member.name: E:Tizen.NUI.Window.TouchEvent
member.summary:
Emits the event when the screen is touched and when the touch ends.
If there are multiple touch points then it is emitted when the first touch occurs and when the last finger is lifted too.
Even though incoming events are interrupted, the event occurs.

Displays a native platform action sheet, allowing the application user to choose from several buttons.
Title of the displayed action sheet. Must not be null. Text to be displayed in the 'Cancel' button. Can be null to hide the cancel action. Text to be displayed in the 'Destruct' button.
